title: VA Video Connect 4+
appDescription: Requires camera ‚Äì does not support Apple Watch. The VA Video Connect (VVC) application provides video conference services to connect Veteran patients with their VA medical providers in multiple platforms. The VVC iOS version enables Veterans and their VA healthcare provider to participate in a virtual medical appointment using Apple mobile devices (iPhone, iPad).

reviews.title: Needs tutorial
reviews.review: Today was first time using it. My provider kept saying he was putting things in the chat. But there wasn't a chat window. After awhile I noticed a red circle with the number changed from 1 to 2 to 3 and recognized the number changed everytime he told me he was putting something in the chat. So I tapped the number and a skinny side window opened with words all scrunched up making them illegible. Then when the meeting ended, nothing. Just a blank window. No way to get to the information he had typed. It disappeared. The connection was fine, the audio and video worked well. It would be so very helpful if there was a tuturial explaining what the icons mean and how to get the typed chat links and info over to where I can store them outside of the meeting so I can use them. more

reviews.title: Quit whining
reviews.review: I think the VA has done an excellent job with this app. I use it on my iPad with WiFi and have had absolutely no problems at all. I did have an issue where the Doctor could not hear me so she left video on and called on the phone. After my appointment was over I realized that my volume on my iPad was all the way down. That was operator error, not a problem with the app. It is a safe and secure way to have a face to face with any doctor at the va. Is positioning of a camera that serious? I think that with everything that is going on in the world today that it is amazing how we as a ‚Äúpeople‚Äù have adapted. At least I can see the people I am talking to. There is absolutely nothing wrong with this app. Absolute Kudos to the developers and again, thank you for sour service and or support. more

reviews.title: It‚Äôs unreliable
reviews.review: This app and VA video connect process has been nothing but problems. Did all the process the test my connection before the meeting and it worked no problem. Even had a VA employee reach out to me to test a video call with her and had problems connecting but we got there in the end. On the morning of my appointment that I had waited 3 weeks for I attempted to connect to the call via the appointment link they sent to my email. I even tried to connect to the call 15 mins early just to make sure there we no problems. I tried 6 different times to use the link just to be meet by a grey screen. Processed to try and call the VA hospital mental health office to try and resolve the issues and get further instructions were I was greeted by voicemail on three different attempts. I just wanted to get some help but it doesn‚Äôt look like that is going to happen. Again thanks for nothing VA. I can only imagine how many other people slip through the cracks as well. more

title: Buku Medicine 17+
appDescription: Buku Medicine was created initially as Buku Haematology, written by a haematology registrar and consultant as an easy and quick reference for the initial investigation and management of common haematology problems. 'Buku' is the Chichewa word for book or reference. Chichewa is spoken in Malawi where our pathology project MPathE is running. We made it to answer the commonest questions that haematologists are asked, and through that, improve patient care, educate our users and hopefully remove some of the fear usually associated with haematology. It is for all grades of generalist and specialist doctors, specialist nurses, physician assistants and has links to key references and guidelines. Data collected from users shows that it can prevent a call to haematology completely for 21% of clinical queries, and start further investigations to expedite care for up to 60% more. This reduces the on-call burden on haematologists and improves patient care by improving clinician efficiency. See our website for testimonials of how it has helped users. This model has been really well received and continues to grow (over 22,000 active users, installed on clinician devices in two NHS trusts and ORCHA approved). We have now started to apply this model to other specialties and have added Renal, Endocrinology, Hepatology and Rheumatology content to the App. We will continue to expand this to other specialties over the coming months. The information included is concise to make it easy to use, and further reading should be undertaken to gain a full understanding of the topics covered. Common causes are listed by frequency from general medical literature and our clinical experience. Please consider taking a couple of minutes to give as little as ¬£1 as a thank you for our time contribution (>400 hours) and to keep the app running. Thanks, Alex, Steve and the Buku Medicine Team Disclaimer: This app has been prepared by Buku Medicine Limited to provide guidance and assistance to healthcare practitioners but does not constitute medical advice. Its content is general in nature, may not reflect all recent clinical developments and guidelines and may not apply to the specific facts or circumstances of a particular case and should therefore be used in conjunction with clinical judgement and local medical specialist advice if required. While this app does provide accurate and useful information, Buku Medicine Limited makes no warranty, express or implied, with regard to the accuracy, omissions and usefulness of the information the app contains. Buku Medicine Limited does not accept any responsibility in contract, tort (including negligence), breach of statutory duty or otherwise arising under or connection with this note for (i) use of this app or (ii) any action taken as a result of the information provided in it or (iii) subsequent damages resulting from the use of the information provided. Nothing in this disclaimer notice limits any liability which cannot legally be limited. For those with an interest in haematology follow @teamhaem on twitter for clinical cases and educational resources. Governance - Our content is written by registrars in their respective fields. Per specialty, there are 2-3 registrars to write content, and a consultant to review that content. This is monitored through a database of active modules, with review dates set for each module. Modules are reviewed every 6 months. Content is general information as would be expected knowledge of a registrar in the specialty. No content is taken into the App from patients, and therefore Buku Medicine is not a medical device as per the MHRA definition. Privacy policy available on our Content website- click on this link https://bukuhaem.appyourself.net/website/ and the policy is at the bottom right of the page. Copyright Buku Tech Limited 2021 @bukuhaematology, @bukurenal, @bukuendo info@bukumedicine.co.uk www.bukumedicine.co.uk more

title: BetterMe: Health Coaching 12+
subtitle: Pilates, Calisthenics, Somatic
appDescription: Personalized workout and nutrition plans supported by real human coaches, comprehensive progress tracking, and cognitive therapy practice-based tips. FIVE REASONS TO INSTALL BetterMe: 1. Customized wholesome approach to weight loss and weight gain We adjust to your busy schedule, preferences and lifestyle to achieve fast results without harming your health 2. Workouts for any level Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or a pro, we‚Äôve got you covered with a variety of exercise sets for at-home or at-the-gym sessions, with zero equipment or a full gym. Even if you‚Äôve never tried to work out in your life, our simple and clear instructions will help prevent injuries and get you accustomed with a fitness world in record time 3. Varied disciplines from cardio to yoga Everyone can find something they like, whether it‚Äôs to get your blood pumping or wind down after a long day. 4. Easy-to-follow meal plans Nutrition plans created by certified experts to boost your progress with options like intermittent fasting, keto, vegan, and many more 5. Support by certified coaches in chat Shoot our coaches a message if you are unsure about what to do, need motivation or just want someone to talk to! We‚Äôre online and are happy to help. App provides you with: - Workout Programs: personalized sets of exercises and nutrition to help you get in shape faster - All-new meal plans: dishes picked according to your preferences, and are easy to make thanks to video recipes - Calorie Tracker: know exactly how much you consume a day and monitor your macros all with an intuitive design - New community with daily articles, tips, tricks, and answers to all the FAQs - Personal coach feature so you are always professionally guided and supported through your weight loss journey - Water tracker and step counter to make sure that you're reaching your daily goals - Yoga, running and walking workouts for everyone! BetterMe offers varied workouts, easy-to-follow meal plans, and useful tips for everyone! There is no need to go to the gym; over 800 of our workouts can be done at home - with our vast library of exercises, everyone will find something to float their boat: from prenatal yoga to guided interval running, get ready to meet your new favorite way to get in shape fast! Getting in shape has a lot to do with nutrition, and we've carefully hand-picked hundreds of recipes for every taste, cooking time, and budget. BetterMe app is also integrated with Health Kit, so that you can track your steps inside the actual app as well as log your water and calorie intake. reviews.title:
We Want Change

    Developer Response
reviews.review: I love the app, but it needs a few more features. I would love to have more choices when it comes to the exercises. They have to think about your physical health, age, and weight. Some exercises are just made for people who are fit, young or both. At the beginning the exercises are modified to a beginner, but then they get more challenging. The problem is that after months of exercising when you‚Äôre overweight and older, your knees start feeling the pain, so I do recommend they stay on a modified exercise when it comes to putting all the weight on your knees or giving you the option within the app. Also, it‚Äôs important to provide two feel good options because it helps you achieve that goal for that day, and also you have an option for those days when your life was crazy busy, active, and full of chaos. Lastly, I have had many problems of it crashing down in the middle of my workout many, many times! This also discourages all the effort we put into a healthier lifestyle. I have even tried it several times, but it constantly crashes down. Also, I can‚Äôt even delete and reinstall the app because it might delete all my data. No easy fix for this until now. more Hello! We are always glad to assist our customers and make their experience more pleasant. Please reach us at gethelp@betterme.tips and we will see what we can do for you. Kind regards, Team BetterMe more

reviews.title:
Enjoyable, needs a few improvements

    Developer Response
reviews.review: With gyms closed, I decided to look for alternate at home exercises. I am in my late 20s and looking to keep an active and healthy lifestyle. This app has great options. I subscribed and I really enjoy the daily 'do your exercises' that fit directly in what I am looking for. I also like the 'workouts' section if I am looking to work a little more on a specific muscle group. Yet, for me honestly I do feel that the food and dietary section is not useful to me. I am not looking for nutritional advice, im only looking for workout ideas so this to me is not useful. I would advice BetterMe to have a full seperate app just for nutrition and one just for workouts with the possibility of merging data from both apps together if the user wants to. Otherwise, a lot of the data on this is just not useful to some people. I do get the whole concept of being a full plan of food and exercise but thats my experience. Another think I want to point out is the 'do your workouts' section of the Plan page. Some days it recommends walking, other days it recommends a full 25 minute exercise routine -which is exactly what i love about this app and why I subscribed to it. Yet, skme days when i check the 'do your workout' section it says 'today walking' it doesn't make sense. I suggest modifying the Plan page to include under the 'do your workouts' section a 'walking' subsection and an 'exercises' subsection. That way you get to have both new options everyday. more Hello! We appreciate you taking the time to let us know what you‚Äôre looking for ‚Äî most of the improvements we make come from ideas and suggestions like yours. Other customers have also expressed their interest in these features, and we can see why. We're forwarding this information to our development team. Have an awesome day! Kind Regards, Team BetterMe more

reviews.title:
Exploring Still!

    Developer Response
reviews.review: After my first workout, I deleted the app and decided this wasn‚Äôt for me. I have EDS Hypermoble type, which to put simply means my joints and connective tissue are not stable. After my first set of exercises, I‚Äôd manage to subluxate both my shoulders and my hips, and was bed bound for several hours. There‚Äôs a reason I do exercises under supervision, either from my physical therapist, or when I can afford it, a personal trainer who‚Äôs fully aware of my condition. However, I brought up trying the app with my physical therapist, and he was very supportive of the idea of trying wall Pilates at home. He had me redownload the app, and after our session went through the individual exercises with me that I‚Äôd had trouble with. (side note, BEST PT ever, I am so happy to have found him.) He helped me find ways to modify them so they were safe for me, or on a couple said ‚Äúthat‚Äôs not for you, I don‚Äôt feel comfortable with you doing that‚Äù. Reminded me to always keep in mind slow and controlled, to not try for full extension since that‚Äôs when I tend to over-extend. I‚Äôve now done my third workout, and I‚Äôm optimistic. While ideally I‚Äôd love to lose weight, right now I‚Äôm focusing on feeling better, and more in control of my unpredictable body. I‚Äôm excited to see that there are so many different types of workouts. My goal for now is 3 times a week. I still have a lot to explore, and see how if effects and hopefully helps me! more Hello! Thanks for sharing your situation openly. We always recommend consulting your physician before starting any new activity or diet. We are glad you adjusted your plan based on your doctor's advice. We believe that you will achieve amazing personal results! Kind Regards, Team BetterMe more

title: iArrest 12+
appDescription: iArrest was developed to give healthcare professionals a powerful tool to navigate stressful and challenging cardiac arrest calls. Whether as a Paramedic on scene or as a clinician in hospital, this app can assist in running structured and effective adult cardiac arrest scenarios. Developed by clinicians working in large inner city teaching hospitals, this app takes into consideration the most recent Resuscitation Council (UK) Guidelines 2021. It serves as an aide-memoire for basic tasks that can easily be overlooked in stressful scenarios. iArrest also incorporates a number of timers to assist with rhythm analysis, adrenaline timings and arrest documentation. It will remind the user via audible and visual cues about necessary interventions even if a clinician‚Äôs phone is muted. iArrest has been programmed to prevent phones from going into sleep mode, in order to ensure continuous use throughout the arrest. iArrest will record the exact time an important event or an intervention has occurred and present the user with a detailed log of events. These logs can be copied to the clipboard and used for documentation and record keeping. iArrest is currently undergoing extensive testing in simulated and real world scenarios. We are continuously improving and expanding on iArrest‚Äôs functionality. Disclaimer: iArrest can not replace sound knowledge in Advance Life Support and should not be used by non-ALS trained clinicians. Use this app at your own risk and always use appropriate clinical judgement. Please familiarise yourself with the functionality of this app before using it in real life scenarios. The creators of this app shall not be liable for any claims or losses arising from the use or misuse of this app, its contents, any omissions from its contents, or otherwise. By using this app you agree to these terms and conditions. more

There are other problems once an account has been created, and I haven‚Äôt even attempted the video appointment yet. This isn‚Äôt a silly game, this is a telehealth app in the middle of a pandemic. reviews.title: Great Company App: Needs a few tweaks

reviews.title: Tasks
reviews.review: Can someone please change the way the task list is presented? If I have 23 tasks, they should all be listed and then at the end yes or no. If yes, end of clocking out. If no, then you can comment on whichever tasks you did not do. This thing where I have to click on every task individually EVERY DAY is annoying and time-consuming. Can someone please change this? P.S. most people are saying yes to everything and not even looking at what these tasks say after the first week of doing it. PLEASE CHANGE THIS! Also please make it so I can see the password when putting it in so I don‚Äôt have to go back and change the whole thing if one letter or number is wrong. This app is really antiquated and not up to par at all. You should also be able to STAY logged in. If I‚Äôm not logging out then I shouldn‚Äôt have to keep logging back in daily. The user name and pw should be able to stay there until further notice. Again, another time- consuming unnecessary step that makes everything that much more annoying. Oh and the part where the stupid thing keeps saying you‚Äôre ‚Äúout of range‚Äù when your right there in the persons HOUSE! There are so many more things wrong with this app but since I know for a fact that no one reads these then what‚Äôs the point of listing them on here? I‚Äôm making it my mission to find a way to contact someone who is in charge of this app. Because this thing is probably one of the worst apps I have ever had to deal with. Changes need to be made! more

reviews.title: ClearCareGo
reviews.review: For several months I thought this was the best app imaginable. Then reality sunk in, for some reason out of the blue (last few days) if I have the face recognition on for log in, the app won‚Äôt log in and keeps throwing me out. The tasks toggles have all but stopped working! You have to almost pound them to get a response or go into each task separately and choose yes or no!! We as caregivers should be able to remove tasks that aren‚Äôt used!! Trying to remember each one and or the time to get someone in the office to remove each task is ridiculous, if you know this business you know none of us has that kind of time!! It shouldn‚Äôt take 10 minutes to clock out!! That‚Äôs time away from clients, personal breaks and driving time!! Personally I stayed booked on the daily so 30 minutes between clients is all I have so you‚Äôve just cut it down to 20 minutes and frankly that‚Äôs just plain selfish of you as developers should understand that!! In my opinion you aren‚Äôt very respectful of our time!! Try being a caregiver for Alzheimer‚Äôs patients just once!! more

reviews.title: Grateful
reviews.review: I am so grateful for everyone‚Äôs help during my surgery‚Äôs and care. Words can not explain just how grateful I truly am . The whole surgical team are gifts from the all mighty, this holds true for all the nurses down to the cleaning staff. The care I was given was simply amazing! I came out of surgery with a whole new understanding! I was not a good patient before my accident. The the understanding I received was knowing my responsibility as a patient! Sound strange maybe however it‚Äôs my truth and I felt the results. I opened my heart and understanding of what these professionals go through to care for their patients that alone was enough to share what they felt. My message is more for patients please show your respect try and understand just how hard they work to get us better. They are your team and they care show them this and they will take it from there. You will get amazing results. Try and understand when the can‚Äôt respond it‚Äôs not because they don‚Äôt care because they do we are not there only patient. reviews.title: My Experience Following Extensive Back Surgery
reviews.review: I had been experiencing severe and chronic back pain. I am 68 years old and have been told that it comes with age and the moderate arthritis. Working with the medical team from Coastal Health, I received restorative back surgery with hopes of restoring my normal life and activities. After initially meeting with Dr Waller I was scheduled for surgery a short time later. Part of the intake process included agreeing to allow a robotic equipment to be used. It is currently 9 days after my surgery and I‚Äôm actually feeling better! A great deal of care was taken to reduce the likelihood of infection. Interestingly enough, the resulting cuts were small and included two small puncture wounds that I assumed was used in conjunction with the robotic, mechanical surgeon. I am up and about with minimal discomfort and I‚Äôm using only a small amount of pain relief medication! I plan to continue this journaling as things continue to unfold. more

After my visit to the emergency department ,I transitioned to the orthopedic institute ,where I received further specialized care .the orthopedic team was outstanding ,demonstrating a deep knowledge of their field while also prioritizing my health. I recommend Swedish Hospital to anyone in need of medical assistance. Thank you to the entire team for your great service. Laura Linares more

reviews.title:
Best App to ever exist in the history of ever

    Developer Response
reviews.review: This is an amazing app! I paid $37 for the student version and it is perfect. I am lucky to be in a class where we have cadavers but I can‚Äôt always go to open lab. So this very useful for visualizing the ligaments and muscles. I love the search feature and being able to add muscles one at a time to the skeleton. I also like that you can hide certain muscles to see those that are deep. The AR feature is great for sketching and the lectures are helpful as well. If you‚Äôre in an online anatomy class especially or without access to cadavers this is your best friend and absolutely worth the price. My only critique is that I would love to be able to save certain skeletons that I build. For example after I add all the muscles that move the pectoral girdle to the skeleton I would love to be able to save it to come back to later. And be able to make ‚Äúplaylists‚Äù of all my saved models so that they‚Äôre easy to find. It‚Äôs possible I just haven‚Äôt figured this out yet too, still learning the app a little bit. more Hello, Ahmed Ammar. Thank you for taking the time leaving us with a 5-star review. We will forward your suggestion to our Development for further review. Please contact our Support Team via https://service.elsevier.com/app/contact/ if you need assistance. Thank you. - (MO), 3D4Medical from Elsevier more

reviews.title:
Keeps Crashing

    Developer Response
reviews.review: I‚Äôve never paid for an app before but I‚Äôm in school to become a Registered Diagnostic Sonographer and I needed something a bit more in-depth, yet, basically ‚Äúdummy proof‚Äù in explaining blood vessel connections and course. If it can help all of these med students then surely it could help me. I wasn‚Äôt expecting this app to do that and so much more. Honestly the best $37 ever spent. I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm memorizing things either; when I gain an understanding of something then it sticks in my head so much better. With my textbooks and class lectures, I‚Äôve just been flash carding everything in my head because alot of the information feels like disjointed information. With this app I feel like relevances has been introduced for the first time. I gave it three stars for one reason only: it keeps crashing. Again, I‚Äôm in school for sonography so being able to locate organs from the transverse view is important. I select the cross-section option in order to see the body habitus transversely and the app closes out completely every time. It worked at first - I only discovered the cross-sectional view this morning but now at 5:30 in the evening it no longer works. An incredible bummer because this app is actually the only reason I now understand what my textbooks have been showing me from that specific view. I honestly don‚Äôt need to make full use of all of the apps capabilities; the few things I do use it for are now only 50% operative. Please fix the crashing üôèüèº more Hello and thank you for your review as well as your in-depth feedback. This sounds like it could be a corrupted download. Please reinstall the app from the App Store. That should solve your problem. If the issue persists however, please contact our Support team directly. https://3d4medical.com/contact. Thank you. -3D4Medical more

reviews.title:
The Best Anatomy App!

    Developer Response
reviews.review: This really is the most comprehensive Anatomy App today. Not only does it include every structure, but it also shows all the forms of movement for every muscle, insertion and origin points and even full courses from experts. That said, the developers need to improve their female Anatomy represetation. Right now you can only see female torso and pelvis. The entire female structure is different than the male, would be great to incide both. Additionally they need to include different skin color options, because diseases present differently on different skin tones. And it's just more inclusive. Make those changes and it would be perfect. Edit: They responded to my question and will have the full female anatomy represented in Winter 2021! Once again the BEST anatomy app. The remaining change for them to make is to add various skin tones to understand how disease presents differently. I'm sure that'll be a quick & easy addition. Thanks developer team! more Hello, thank you for your feedback. We are very much concerned about the lack of a full female model. That is why we have developed the most accurate, most detailed female pelvis and female thorax on the market. We are striving to generate a true representation of the female anatomy and not merely a feminized version of the male anatomy as is currently most common in the 3D anatomy market. We hope to release a full female model in the Winter of 2021. Thank you. - 3D4Medical. more

reviews.title:
Purposefully making ‚Äúcompliant‚Äù wear time no less than 22 hours

    Developer Response
reviews.review: My doctor AND Invisalign corporate recommend aligners be worn 20-22 hours per day to be compliant. Yet, your app‚Äôs user is only deemed compliant with nothing less than 22 hours of wear. Why have you taken it upon yourselves to disregard two hours of the day the manufacturer and board certified orthodontists direct as compliant? Not only have you sent this message to patients, but you go further to not allow any manual adjustment or override of your incorrect definition of compliant hours. It‚Äôs easy on the coding end to let users have a choice of hours per day to set as compliant in consultation with their doctor. Your app is designed to interact with the patient‚Äôs doctor‚Äôs office. So if you can‚Äôt offer the designation of 20 hours, how is this really helpful for an orthodontist or their staff to quickly glance at a patient‚Äôs history through this app and all they see is a non-compliant when in fact the patient has worn the aligners for 20 hours or more? Don‚Äôt you think they are frustrated and feel it‚Äôs not purposeful for them? Do you understand how demotivating it is for the user/patient to see that their non-compliant status every day for weeks/months when they have been within 20 to 22 hours? You are doing this on purpose, why I‚Äôm not sure. But you are taking the user‚Äôs joy and support by not using the professional guidelines. more Thanks for sharing with us how the app could be better for you. Your pain experience is unique, and your recovery program should be, too. Depending on your needs, Curable can help you to overcome fear of movement, reduce health anxiety, relax the nervous system, navigate flare-ups, and more. Hundreds of thousands of people in pain have used Curable to help them transform their relationship to back pain, migraine, shoulder pain, neck pain, knee pain, arthritis, fibromyalgia, trigeminal neuralgia, post-surgical pain, ME/CFS, sciatica, tinnitus, and more. Curable is not a tool to monitor your symptoms - it‚Äôs a tool to help you transform them. 69% of Curable users begin to experience physical symptom reduction in the first 30 days of use. We hope that you will be next! - *Source: Devan H, Farmery D, Peebles L, Grainger R Evaluation of Self-Management Support Functions in Apps for People With Persistent Pain: Systematic Review JMIR Mhealth Uhealth 2019;7(2):e13080 URL: https://mhealth.jmir.org/2019/2/e13080 DOI: 10.2196/13080 PMID: 30747715 PMCID: 6390192 - Free Resources & Paid Subscription Terms The Curable app offers numerous resources free of charge. reviews.title:
I love this app! It does what it says!

    Developer Response
reviews.review: This app is so good! If you have any uncontrollable pain, or even a persistent discomfort, this app can help you. There is a wealth of knowledge that helps you understand that your brain is what tells us that we have pain. All pain originates in our brain - this does NOT mean the pain is in our heads, but that our brains generate the amount of pain we feel. We can also change our brain‚Äôs response to something that has caused us pain, and therefore reduce the pain. Knowledge is power, and in this case it is a scientifically proven, therapeutic way to reduce pain. I also love the recovery stories and expert interviews. There is guided meditation to help you relax (not my favorite because I don‚Äôt like her voice - I use a different exercise app), writing activities, and brain training. The only thing I wish were improved was that there would be more education and brain training into opportunities. For me, these alone helped get rid of my pain. It also reduced or eliminated other uncomfortable sensations I was feeling in my body (e.g., a really weird metallic/sour taste in my mouth I experienced for 9 months with no other medical explanation). I really think it was stress, and this app took it away for me! Please don‚Äôt hesitate to buy this app. It is worth it‚Äôs weight in gold (and cost of medical and psychotherapy sessions)! more Hi there - Thank you so much for sharing your positive and constructive feedback with us! We are glad to hear that you enjoy the app and that it has helped you. Best wishes, Jack from Curable Support more

reviews.title:
40 years of pain GONE

    Developer Response
reviews.review: I am 57 years old, and I‚Äôve been suffering from back pain since I was in my teens. For many years as a teenager I saw a physical therapist to help with my back pain. Unfortunately, it only helped a little. I live a very healthy lifestyle, and about 3 to 5 times a year my back will go out, and I will be completely debilitated for several days. Sometimes I am completely unable to even get off the floor or get out of bed as the pain is unbearable. The only thing I have found that helps is to continually exercise. Over the years I‚Äôve consulted with many surgeons that said I was not a candidate for surgery. A few years ago I started getting epidural injections that would minimize the frequency of my severe lower back spasms. Of course I don‚Äôt like getting the injections and I haven‚Äôt had one in over 14 months. 2 1/2 months ago, I started using the Curable app and I‚Äôve been 90% pain-free. I still have experienced back spasms, but unlike previously when I would be bedridden for a day or two and have to take pain pills and anti inflammatories and miss work for a few days, now my spasms go away within about a minute and so does the pain. I‚Äôm blown away by the results and am enjoying the process along the way. I honestly thought that I was going to live with this condition for the rest of my life, but now I know there‚Äôs a better way. more Hi there - Thank you for sharing a little about your journey with us. Congratulations on all of your amazing progress! Be well, Jack from Curable Support more

reviews.title:
Helping me manage pain from FAI/ labral tears/ back pain - amazing!

    Developer Response
reviews.review: This app has been an absolute lifesaver over the past month. I was laid up in bed for 10 days not only with the pain of my congenital injury, but also with side effects of prednisone which led to excruciating muscle spasms in my quads that forced me completely out of commission because of the pain. I was on hydrocodone, but I was able to wean off of it by using this app to change my relationship with the pain and to breathe into a different mindset. Just this morning, I woke up with my back spasming, and I immediately went into fear mode. But I put on a meditation from this app, and I was able to calm my mind and my body, and therefore the pain has subsided considerably and I am able to move and function today. I also just completed the journal, and it helped calm my perspective on what lies ahead for me. I love that all of the lessons are research-based with valid scientific evidence. I hold a Master‚Äôs Degree in Kinesiology with a focus on Integrative Wellness, and so I understand the research that is relevant to this app since I have studied it previously. Even with that ‚Äúlogical‚Äù background, I am human and can still spiral into overwhelm and fear when the pain flares up. This app is just so well-designed, and I find myself recommending it to everyone I know who might be dealing with pain. Highly recommend! more Hey there - Thank you for taking the time to share a little bit about yourself and your experience with the app. We are thrilled to hear that the material is resonating with you and helping you along your journey. Be well, Susie from Curable Support more

reviews.title:
Great hearing aids, app is not dependable

    Developer Response
reviews.review: I love my new hearing aids and have been getting used to hearing my phone calls and music through them, along with everything around me. All great up until iOS 16.6 and they no longer stream or show as any option to use on my phone. They pair just fine but limited use for the app now and frustrating after getting used to hearing phone calls through them. I tried support and they didn‚Äôt even read the issue and just resent instructions on how to pair. Support really should not assume starting at step one especially when issue is explained. Back to removing hearing aids when I listen to music or stream.**Update** I was curious what response I would receive. Turns out the same as the emails, no help at all, pointing me to email again as though I had not tried two times already with the same canned reply. HOWEVER, the replies do contain a phone number which was my last option. I called and the person on the other end mentioned one VERY IMPORTANT step not in ANYTHING supplied so far. I had to place my hearing aids into the charger to re-pair the third streaming portion of the app. Phonak, I suggest adding this to your auto replies. more We apologize for the inconvenience and will forward your feedback to our developers team. For any help and support, please contact us at: apps@sonova.com Regards, Sonova Apps Team. more

reviews.title:
Phonak - Top Quality Hearing Aides

    Developer Response
reviews.review: I have had a moderately severe hearing lost in both ears since birth. They failed to note my hearing lost until I was 7 years old. It was through the a very observant second grade teacher that my severe hearing deficit was discovered. Before that discovery, I repeatedly got in trouble because what was in reality was an inability to hear was chalked up as me beings a poor learner, poor attitude, and as one who had at birth had a intelligence deficit due to having also had a partially arrested hydrocephalus as well as hemolytic disease of some the newborn at birth as well. It once it was. discovered that a hearing deficit in both ears, I was fitted with hearing aides. That made all the difference in the world. I went from C‚Äôs,D‚Äôs, and F‚Äôs to A‚Äôs and B‚Äôs. So, I have been wearing hearing aides for a very long time. I can say that of all the various types of hearing aides that I have worn over the years, I can say without reservation that Phonak is the very best hearing aides that I have ever had. I will have no other. I hear things now that I have never heard before. Hearing conversations is effortless and clear. So, I unequivocally give Phonak 5 stars ! I would give more, but 5 is the top rating. They are absolutely top rated hearing aides. more Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us and taking the time to leave an excellent rating. We really appreciate! Regards, Sonova Apps Team more

reviews.title:
Great hearing aid

    Developer Response
reviews.review: I have owned hearing aids in the past. Purchased high quality aids about 15 years ago and could never get accustomed to them. Found myself not using them due to their amplification of all sounds around you. I then later tried a lower cost hearing units and they did the same. So for the last 7 years I didn‚Äôt use hearing aids. My hearing was very difficult when trying to have conversations. I decided that my quality of life had to improve not just for me but those around me. I hope that technology had improved. I wanted top professional help so I went to highly recommended audiologist. I was fitted with some great hearing aids that I forget I‚Äôm wearing them. And my hearing has much improved during conversations in various noisy locations or just listening to the TV. You owe it to yourself and the ones around you to find a hearing aid if you are having difficulty with hearing certain words and pitches. And you can go walking and answer the telephone or play music grime your smartphone. Love them. Glad I made the decision to improve my life. more Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us and taking the time to leave an excellent rating. We really appreciate! Regards, Sonova Support Team more

reviews.title:
Read ALL of the privacy sections

    Developer Response
reviews.review: It may or may not be a good App, I do not know because I stopped and deleted after reading their ‚Äúprivacy‚Äù policy. It is shocking. Their ‚Äúprivacy policy does not apply to the personal information they collect‚Äù. That is taken from paragraph 1 of their policy. Paragraph 2 allows then to collect personal information directly and automatically and third party, including social media. Paragraph 3 allows them to share my personal information with companies that market with them, for analytics with their affiliates. Paragraph 5 allows their tracking on any Facebook, Google, and LinkedIn, etc., for what I view. If I deny their use of ‚Äúcookies‚Äù, information that take to ‚Äúbetter benefit me‚Äù, and I configure ‚ÄúDNT (do not track)‚Äù, their system is set up to ignore my request, allowing them to track signals from my browsers and mobile devices. In some states, I can request deletion of files twice a year, free of charge, but by then, damage is done. You cannot undo what has been shared. I could go on, but please read everything. They escape legalities by informing us what they do, so we are then helpless. My information is taken directly from their website. I encourage you to read and think twice, is it really worth it, taking advantage of patients during COVID, when there is no other choice? more Hi there, I‚Äôd like to address your concerns with our Privacy Policy. To clarify, our Privacy Policy does apply to the Personal Information we collect from our customers, but doesn‚Äôt apply to clients‚Äô Private Health Information (PHI) stored in customer accounts. Client information is protected by more stringent HIPAA regulations and our BAA. SimplePractice is HITRUST certified, which is the gold standard for measuring the security and compliance of an Electronic Health Records software. We do not sell, or disclose client data to third-party platforms in any capacity and take great precautions to ensure that our team is properly trained to handle PHI, when necessary to help customers with account specific questions. The Personal Information we reference in the Privacy Policy only applies to the information customers disclose when creating an account, reach out to us for assistance with their account, information we request when verifying a customer‚Äôs identity, or if they decide to interact with us through one of our social networks. The collection of Personal Information is used to directly service our customers, and internally analyze how we can best help our users and enhance our product. Our third-party partners are covered by our BAA and are only given the information necessary to provide services through our platform, such as our Online Payments function. They also do not sell, or share information collected through our platform. The use of cookies, or data collected through online activity is not unique to SimplePractice. Unlike some sites, that share and sell data, the sole use of this data in SimplePractice is to identify trends in customer engagement, diagnose server issues, protect against security breaches and manage risk. Thank you for your thorough review, let me know if there‚Äôs anything I didn‚Äôt cover, or if you‚Äôd like me to elaborate on any of the points made. - Ruth more

I think she is going to be an asset wherever she works when she‚Äôs done with Next Chapter.. it‚Äôs hard to find a therapist. That is a good fit. title: Pathway ‚Äì Medical Knowledge 17+
subtitle: Clinical Decision Support
appDescription: Pathway is an accurate and efficient point-of-care reference tool that gives physicians, nurses, physician assistants, pharmacists, residents, and students rapid access to guideline summaries, mobile-friendly interactive algorithms, clinical calculators, landmark trials and more. ‚Ä¢ 40 medical specialties ‚Ä¢ 900+ diseases ‚Ä¢ 75,000+ topics ‚Ä¢ 120+ interactive pathways 96% 5 Star Reviews Trusted by clinicians in over 180 countries AS SEEN IN ‚Ä¢ MobiHealthNews: "A well-designed decision support technology adapted to the realities of 21st-century medicine." ‚Ä¢ Physicians Practice: "Provides easier access to important clinical information." SIMPLIFY YOUR DAILY PRACTICE ‚Ä¢ Find what you need, faster, with condensed summaries of evidence-based clinical guidelines. ‚Ä¢ Get patient-specific guidance with mobile-friendly interactive algorithms. ‚Ä¢ Easily assess the evidence with color codes, explanations, and links to the original text for seamless due diligence. ‚Ä¢ Quickly reference landmark trial summaries for 500+ diseases, all in one place. ‚Ä¢ Make the right diagnosis by easily consulting pertinent findings when a diagnosis is under question. ‚Ä¢ Find exactly what you need with deep search and an intuitive interface that understands you. ‚Ä¢ Stay up-to-date with notifications for practice-changing updates tailored to your specialty. ‚Ä¢ Get reliable guidance anytime, anywhere - even without an Internet connection. REVIEWS ‚ÄúNone of the clinical reference tools available are as simple, efficient and to-the-point. This is the only medical app I use on a daily basis.‚Äù - Jane R., General Practitioner ‚ÄúThe simple layout of guidelines is very much appreciated and allows for rapid access of clinical guidelines which is incredibly handy in a time sensitive situation.‚Äù - Louis S., Clinical Pharmacist ‚ÄúPerhaps the hardest part of medicine is information overload and Pathway provides the best solution to this challenge I have seen.‚Äù - Christian L., 2nd year resident ‚ÄúThe color-coded evidence assessments are very useful for quickly evaluating the quality of the evidence. I‚Äôve recommended Pathway to my colleagues and will continue to do so.‚Äù - Katie G., General Practitioner EVOLVING EVIDENCE-BASED MEDICINE With over 800,000 medical studies published every year, it‚Äôs nearly impossible to stay up-to-date on clinical guidelines and best practices. Our physician authors and editors painstakingly review, assess, and summarize the highest quality evidence-based clinical information and display it in a clear, simple interface to be acted on at the point of care. We master what‚Äôs tedious so you can master what‚Äôs important‚Äîcaring for your patients. STAY CONNECTED ‚Ä¢ Website: https://pathway.md ‚Ä¢ Email: contact@pathway.md ‚Ä¢ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pathwaymedical/ ‚Ä¢ Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/pathwaymedical/ ‚Ä¢ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/pathwaymedical/ LEARN MORE ‚Ä¢ Frequently Asked Questions: http://www.pathway.md/faq/ ‚Ä¢ Terms of Use: https://www.pathway.md/terms-of-use/ ‚Ä¢ Privacy Policy: https://www.pathway.md/privacy-policy/ *Pathway is intended for physicians, medical residents, medical students, registered nurses, and other licensed health professionals only.* more

reviews.title:
Pharmacist

    Developer Response
reviews.review: Pathway breaks down information in such a way that it's easy to find what you need. Databases like uptodate are great but are hard to read, the average sentence is 16-20 words long, which requires you to sit and evaluate the information, you can't really skim or read it on the go. Pathway is great for rounds, studying for boards and putting together presentations more Thank you for the glowing review! Your success is our success, and your feedback fuels our drive to keep improving. Keep the suggestions coming, and thank you for making Pathway a part of your daily toolkit! more

title: SleepScore 12+

appDescription: SleepScore features patented, non-contact, sonar sleep tracker technology to measure your sleep from your nightstand, personalized actionable advice, sleep sounds, smart alarm, sleep cycle analysis, and more. Plus, try SleepScore‚Äôs lifestyle challenges, sleep sounds, smart alarm, DreamScape, and more. FEATURED IN: Washington Post, The New York Times, Forbes, CNN, Men‚Äôs Health, Huffington Post, Wirecutter, USA Today, Business Insider, Digital Trends, & more! UNDERSTAND YOUR SLEEP -Track your sleep with SleepScore‚Äôs patented non-contact, accurate sonar technology -Explore insights about your unique sleep cycles each night -View trend & correlation charts based on your sleep patterns and lifestyle analysis -Receive a weekly sleep report to easily view and identify trends -Access your lifetime sleep history, trends, and sleep cycle analysis -Access validated screeners if signs of a more serious sleep disorder are detected -Download a comprehensive 30-day sleep report and screener results to share sleep concerns with your doctor IMPROVE WITH SCIENCE BACKED FEATURES, ADVICE, AND MORE -Receive daily actionable tips tailored to your lifestyle and sleep habits -Set sleep goals to focus on what you what‚Äôs important to you, or let SleepScore learn about your sleep and suggest the right goal for you -Try weekly sleep challenges to learn new behaviors that can improve your sleep and wellness -Listen to soothing sleep sounds that gradually slow down to help you relax and fall asleep faster -Measure and optimize the light, temperature, and sound levels in your bedroom -Wake refreshed with the Smart Alarm, designed to gently wake you in the morning at the ideal time in your sleep cycle APP HEALTH DATA Our app integrates with the Apple Health app to add your sleep data and read your activities, such as exercise. On supported devices, SleepScore reads data from the Health App with your permission to update your activities during the day to provide more personalized advice. SleepScore also writes sleep data to the Health app with permission. SUBSCRIPTION PRICING AND TERMS SleepScore is free to download and use. For advanced features, SleepScore has auto-renewing monthly & yearly subscription options. If you choose to purchase SleepScore, payment will be charged to your iTunes account. Auto-renewal may be turned off at any time by going to your settings in the iTunes store. Any unused portion of a free trial period will be forfeited when you purchase a subscription to SleepScore. reviews.title:
Helps improve my functioning with chronic illness

    Developer Response
reviews.review: I‚Äôve been using the app for about 4 months now. I have ME/CFS along with fibromyalgia and arthritis. When I first started using the app I noticed I was getting less than 30min of REM sleep a night and not enough deep sleep either. When I was able to get more REM sleep I noticed I felt much better and energy is improved overall. So as I‚Äôve been using the app to increase my REM and deep sleep, my overall functioning has gotten better. Of course it‚Äôs not a cure for my chronic illness but has made a big difference! And for anyone with ME/CFS, you know that little bit better functioning is actually huge! It‚Äôs relatively low cost, the free version has worked fine but I paid for the subscription to save my data. It‚Äôs surprisingly accurate too. I can see when I wake up what kind of day I will be having now based on the data and knowing my body. The sleep score doesn‚Äôt always mean I feel well rested/alert because of my individual health issues but I can tell if I have enough sleep including rem and deep sleep that it will correlate to better functioning. more Thank you very much for your 5-star review!!! Glad you like it! :) more

reviews.title:

reviews.review: Liking this app a lot after about a week and a half of use. My only real feedback I would give right now is that there doesn‚Äôt seem to be a way to adjust the volume on my device in regard to the smart alarm feature. I really like this feature and I feel it has reduced my grogginess upon waking, but the app seems to have a default volume level for the alarm that is significantly louder than it needs to be, especially considering how close your device is in order to track your sleep! My husband is not usually woken up by my alarms but this one is so loud that it has woken him up a few times, and when I try to turn it down on my phone, the app moves the volume level right back up. Maybe this is just a bug that could be fixed? I would definitely recommend this app as it does have a lot of really good features and is a really good learning tool, but it does still have just some general bugs to be worked out. more Hi, thank you for providing your feedback. reviews.title:
Loving Care

    Developer Response
reviews.review: Hinge Health is an excellent resource available to take care of yourself and make a difference in your health and longevity. My doctor was talking surgery. To me, surgery is a last resort. Insurance provided the opportunity to participate in Hinge Health physical therapy as a starting alternative. Knowing that physical therapy can make a huge difference I signed up. Hinge Health provided an excellent solution and I can participate fully right here at home. HH provided targeted physical therapy in an easy to follow format that allows me work at my own pace while strengthening and rebuilding weak areas. With HH, I have eliminated 95% of the pain associated with my condition and am becoming stronger daily, thus nullifying some of the underlying factors that contributed to my initial problem. Building up your strength slowly, with the help of your coach and the exercises customized to your needs can make all the difference long term. HH provides everything you need including your own online coach to cheer you on and monitor your progress. I have been using this program, sometimes not as much as I should, and recently realized that I have achieved some core strengths and abilities that I have never been able to do, even when I was younger and in top shape. Challenge yourself and give yourself the gift of targeted, loving care. The work you put in is worth every minute. The pay off is a stronger you. Maybe even stronger than ever! more Hi Data123654, Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience in such great detail! We are thrilled to hear that you eliminated 95% of the pain associated with your condition. Your review is extremely valuable and keeps us striving to always go above and beyond with our program offerings. We are grateful to partner with you on your wellness journey. Sincerely, Anne from Hinge Health Support more

I like the access to both a therapist who you can have telehealth appointments with to discuss individualizing your plan and a health coach to check in and encourage. I have had significant improvement in both programs and continue to feel much better and stronger. I can stick with doing my exercises weekly for I can do them on my own time and at home. The videos they provide are great and the articles are very helpful and informative. I tell all my doctors about this program and how it‚Äôs helped me. I used to have urinary frequency and urgency and pudendal nerve pain affecting me when sitting. Where I used to have to go to the bathroom every hour each morning, with the urgency being painful, I can go three hours in between and the signal to go is not painful. The nerve pain that would flare during sitting periods has greatly reduced and I have easy stretches throughout the workday to do to help. I know all my improvements have been from doing this pelvic floor exercise program that I have completed and I will continue weekly to do the exercises to maintain. more We are thrilled to hear about the positive impact our program has had on your health and well-being. Your dedication to the exercises and the support from our physical therapists and health coaches are key elements to your success. Thank you for sharing your experience with your doctors, we appreciate your kind words! Sincerely, Jess from Hinge Health Support more

reviews.title:

reviews.review: I had done PT for a torn meniscus and realized that I had to keep the work going after PT ended to maintain my progress. I was struggling to be consistent on my own and identify new exercises that progressing with my improvements. I was falling off and my pain level increased. I was frustrated and demoralized. I took advantage of the app provided through my insurance. Through consistency I am back to longer walks, biking, dance sessions and more! The education passages at the end of each session have been so helpful particularly when I had a flare up. I‚Äôve had flare up‚Äôs thats been attributed to arthritis (Uncle Arthur has been uninvited from the family reunion üòÇ) and this practice continues to provide benefits! I regularly go to the gym and workout in my own now AND I still find it invaluable to keep up this practice as my PT continues to modify my exercises to continue to strengthen the chain. I remember when I didn‚Äôt think I would ever walk with out pain, stand up with ease, or even get up off the floor again! Combining the app workouts with regular activity and exercise, puts me well on my way to pay personal goal of dancing and performing for hours again. It has been a journey to get back to the active lifestyle I‚Äôve always wanted and my body craves! You can do this too! more Thank you for sharing your experience with us! We're thrilled to hear that our app has helped you stay consistent with your exercise routine and manage your pain levels. It's inspiring to see how far you've come and we're here to support you on your journey to an active lifestyle. Keep up the great work! Best, Jess from Hinge Health Support more

reviews.title: Patient‚Äôs who can‚Äôt use Ambra, here‚Äôs how to have a great experience
reviews.review: As a patient, you can gain access to this program, but you need help from your participating health care program. Basically, you just need to have their records department share an old Ambra image with your email address. Then, sign in to your account by going through your health service (MyChart, for instance) then Test Results, get an automatic sign in link to view your imaging. Once you‚Äôre there, select all your imaging, and share them to your email address. Now that you have an Ambra account, and all your records are available through your Ambra account, all of your records will be available through this app. Note: After each new imaging, you‚Äôll need to access Ambra through your health service account, through the Ambra portal, and then it‚Äôll also be available. I‚Äôve had to figure this all out through being diagnosed with multiple sclerosis, getting stable imaging results, and learning as much as I can. MRIs are paramount to the status of multiple sclerosis patients, and this app has earned 5-stars for me!! more

Over 50,000 parents use Nara Baby every day to track, learn and grow alongside their babies Track breastfeeding & bottle feeding - Tap the breastfeeding timer to track left/right feeding; Nara notes which side ended the last feed - Track bottle feeding (formula or breastmilk) by time and amount - Record and track solids ‚Äî dozens of first foods are already preloaded - Identify feeding patterns and create a feeding schedule - Upload photos and notes for any feeding session - Log breast pumping sessions with amount and duration - Use the pumping timer on each side for easy tracking - Not breastfeeding? reviews.title:
Beautiful, Simple, and Quality

    Developer Response
reviews.review: If you are looking for a simple way to track your baby‚Äôs feedings, diapers, and sleep plus your pumping output and record milestones, this is the best app out there. Not only is it aesthetically pleasing but it‚Äôs intuitive and practical. You can compare how things have changed in 1 day, 1 week, or 2 week chunks but it isn‚Äôt overwhelming. I was nervous that I would become too obsessive in tracking my baby‚Äôs feedings or sleep so this gives me just what I need to ensure he‚Äôs well fed and well rested. Bonus feature I didn‚Äôt start using until about 3 months in are the widgets! You can add multiple Nara Baby widgets to your Home Screen for easy access to the features you use the most. It‚Äôs so convenient to just look at my phone for a quick reminder of how long it‚Äôs been since he ate or how long he‚Äôs been asleep rather than opening the app each time. I also just had a wonderful experience with the app‚Äôs tech support. The widgets had frozen on me and were not updating so I wrote the developers an email detailing the issue. Didn‚Äôt really expect to get a reply but I was so desperate for what had become my favorite feature to work again that I took a chance. To my surprise, they not only responded to let me know they‚Äôd be looking into it but also emailed me when they released an update that would hopefully correct the issue! The widgets now work again and I‚Äôm a very loyal Nara Baby fan! more We're thrilled to hear about your positive experience with Baby Tracker by Nara! It's wonderful to know that the app has been helpful in tracking your baby's needs and milestones. Thank you for highlighting the convenience of the widgets and sharing your tech support experience. Your feedback truly means a lot to us. If you ever need further assistance, feel free to reach out. Happy tracking! more

reviews.title:
Baby and Mama tracking done right!

    Developer Response
reviews.review: This app is gold. It has all the common activities you‚Äôd want to track for your baby done simply, beautifully, intuitively, and without fuss. I love that you can be as specific or as simple as you want, other apps won‚Äôt let you save an activity without filing out all the fields. As a second time mom, there‚Äôs plenty of times where the toddler distracts me from logging right away and getting some info entered later in the day is better than none! As others have mentioned, typing things in or just hitting start/stop is intuitive and easy - I‚Äôm never saying ‚Äúhow do I do this?‚Äù with this app! BUT what makes this app really special is the ability to track activities for mom. With my first baby, the baby blues quickly spiraled into Postpartum Depression because keeping myself hydrated, fed, and showered was easy to forget. While babies cry to remind you something‚Äôs forgotten, Mama bodies will just keep grinding until you‚Äôre so depleted you can‚Äôt get out of bed. Tracking myself along with baby in one place is simple and beautifully executed! There‚Äôs even the ability to track mom sleep (not that you have much control over it) but when you ‚Äúwake up‚Äù from a night of 2 hour stretches b/c of a growth spurt, it‚Äôs easy to see why you feel foggy and short fused! Without a doubt I‚Äôm a better mamma because of the insight I get from this app! more Thank you so much for your glowing review! We're thrilled to hear that you find our app intuitive, easy to use, and helpful in tracking both your baby's activities and your own. We're glad that the app has made your life as a second-time mom much easier. If you have any questions or need further assistance, please don't hesitate to let us know. more

reviews.title:
An especially useful app for an especially demanding need!

    Developer Response
reviews.review: I‚Äôm not even one for being on my phone much, but I‚Äôve got to say it: the convenience and utility offered by Nara, being able to glance at timers and a calendar for a quick visual overview of where your baby is at, is so incredibly helpful by taking the stress out of having to otherwise keep track of everything manually in your head, while still having all of life‚Äôs other demands on your plate. Multiple caretakers also benefit greatly: my wife and I, even grandma for example; anyone added to the app can mark changes, feedings, naps, and more, while anyone with their phone can also see the updates in real time. It makes coordination so much easier. Lastly, you can see from the calendar view and other metrics how your baby grows and changes over time, to include their natural rhythms, when & how often they‚Äôre hungry, how & when they need naps and sleep, etc., to the degree that you can easily predict what needs are coming up next and how to fold them into your plans. TL;DR: this app greatly makes light the work of a parent‚Äôs job in scheduling and timekeeping for their baby. Eventually you‚Äôll outgrow the need for it, but in the demanding early days especially, it is so massively handy and a habit worth investing the time into using! more We truly appreciate your detailed feedback and are glad to hear how the app has helped to streamline and simplify the demanding task of parenting in those early days! Your insights on the convenience and utility provided by the app for caregivers are invaluable. more

Checked back about an hour later (typically when I do this, it takes the funds out of my balance within seconds), funds were all still there. I look in pending transactions and my recent bill pay submission isn‚Äôt there. I waited and checked back today- it‚Äôs like it never happened. This app allows you to go all the way to the submit screen, submit it, tells you you‚Äôre all set, but meanwhile is doing absolutely nothing. I called customer service and they were dumbfounded, telling me ‚Äúoh if it said you submitted it then you did but I don‚Äôt see it here. Can you do it on the phone with me now? It should show up in real time.‚Äù I go through all of the steps for a third time, nothing shows up. No pending transaction. reviews.review: With my prior 2 years experience with heart problems and multiple procedures and test, my aortic valve was discussed multiple times! I was told it wasn‚Äôt ready for replacement! After a hospital stay in December 2023 I was released from the hospital with shortness of breath and fatigue/weakness and edema in my legs symptoms! My insurance authorized home care nurse and physical therapy. After several weeks my progress was minimal and the shortness of breath and edema had gotten worse! At that point my home care nurse called my nephrologist with concerns of my well being. I was told to go directly to hospital ED and she, the nephrologist , would meet me there! After a couple of test it was determined I needed my aortic valve replaced! I was admitted to Advent Hospital Pepin Heart Institute for the surgery. After a weekend of dialysis I was cleared for surgery and the results were a miracle! Now 30 days after TAVR surgery I‚Äôm feeling better everyday and currently attending Advent Cardiac Rehabilitation and I‚Äôm up to 2 miles on my goal of 3 miles a day in the near future! Feeling better than good and thankful to God, my Doctors, Nurses, Technicians at Advent Hospital for saving my life! God is Good!üôè more We are delighted to hear about your remarkable journey to recovery and the outstanding care you received at AdventHealth. Thank you for sharing your inspiring story with us! more

reviews.title: Winter Park Hospital
reviews.review: I was admitted due to a fall in August 2024 and the care I received was phenomenal from the minute I walked in, everyone was attentive and helpful trying to ease my concerns. Once I was admitted to a room I was quickly taken for the required test and monitored every hour. I saw many people, doctors, nurses and specialists but one nurse was absolutely amazing. Her name was Kendra and I honestly have never met a human who was attentive, calm, patient and kind as her. She checked on me kept me informed on my status got me food early because I had not eaten anything and while I took a shower she changed my bedding. During discharge she told me what to look for and things in my labs I should follow up on. She was the sweetest caring nurse I have ever met and truly helped me during that very scary situation. I thank everyone who I came in contact with those two days I was there but she will forever be in my heart for the care she provided me. more

reviews.title:
Loved the app in the former version

reviews.review: This is crazy! The old sensors are discontinued, so I had to get the new one. I thought the problems I read in the other reviews were probably not going to be an issue because my sugar is pretty stable. No hi-low alarms for me‚Ä¶ well I hate to say that alarm still goes off randomly and at the most inopportune times! I was in a meeting and got a little too far away from my phone. By the time I got to get into the app and stop it, the alarm had gone off 4 times! And when I use the word alarm, I mean it. It is very loud, ear-piercing and startling, not just annoying. That‚Äôs great if it‚Äôs saving somebody‚Äôs life, but utterly ridiculous for me at this point. That being said, in setting you can (supposedly) shut off the alarm for when your Bluetooth cannot connect, like when you‚Äôre too far from your phone. So I did that, but it still alarms sometimes for no good reason. No trouble with my sugar, and no identifiable reason for an alarm. !_! Problem is, I‚Äôm stuck. At least for the month, since I already paid for two new sensors. And one more thing, this one is reading consistently higher than the other one did, and I have not changed my very strict diet. I know it‚Äôs not accurate enough to make treatment decisions based on this sensor, but it‚Äôs still disturbing. We‚Äôll see what my next blood test says. In the meantime I just keep using this sensor and hope it doesn‚Äôt startle me into having a wreck while driving. RANT OVER more Thanks for the comment. We'll need more information to help with this issue, so please contact our Customer Care team at 855-632-8658. more

reviews.title:

    Developer Response
reviews.review: As someone who is blind, this is a great app, but I haven‚Äôt even used it for 24 hours and the alarms are annoying which isn‚Äôt that bad because you can just turn them off. however, the real problem is the fact that you need to constantly run the app in order to receive those alarms and there‚Äôs no way to run the app‚Äôs alarm feature in the background or more specifically, while the app is closed. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs normal for the sensor to lose its signal with your phone while the app is closed but it makes no sense why the app has to run to stay connected to the sensor and receive alarms and within the first 24 hours of attaching the sensor to my arm, it lost its signal 3 times Plus, having the app always running will just drain your device‚Äôs battery quicker which I don‚Äôt appreciate due to the fact that I have an older iPhone model. you need to fix the app so that you don‚Äôt need it to constantly run just to be able to use the alarms. I mean most GPS apps allow and give you the option to use your location while the app itself is closed. So, why can‚Äôt you just receive the alarms while the app is closed? It‚Äôs so annoying that I have to charge my phone even more now because of this app draining my battery while open. more Thanks for the comment. We appreciate hearing from you. more

reviews.title:
Needs Improvement

    Developer Response
reviews.review: This app is supposed to help improve my blood sugar by constantly monitoring it, but it actually makes it worse. Let me tell you why. Unless you turn the sensoring off all together, it would obnoxiously allow. I understand it‚Äôs for my health, but I can not have this thing beeping and going off so annoyingly all the time. I have work, I go to church, I need to sleep. There are lots of places where I can‚Äôt just have this thing beeping. You do realize that if I‚Äôm high, and I do a correction it takes time for my blood sugar to come back up. But it‚Äôll keep going off, it‚Äôll keep saying I‚Äôm high even though I already corrected it. So I just turn it off and then forget to turn it on and miss being more accurate in my blood sugar because this thing is so annoying. Me and both my 2 diabetic friends have talked about it, we all turn it off until we need to test again. If I got a nice silent notification that my blood sugar is high, I would correct it. Vs not knowing at all for an extra 3 hours because I turned it off. There NEEDS to be a setting to turn off the sound and still get notifications. Stop trying to control us so much that this thing has to beep so loud and so obnoxiously when we‚Äôre not in target and just make it like a text message so we can choose wether it‚Äôs completely silent, vibrates, or alarms. Because I promise you‚Äôre doing more harm than help. more We're sorry to hear this. Please contact our Customer Care team at 1-855-632-8658 so we can better assist. more

title: VentilO 17+
seller: L'Institut universitaire de cardiologie et de pneumologie de Qu√©bec (IUCPQ)
appDescription: The VentilO application is a mobile educational application that allows healthcare professionals in charge of patients with mechanical ventilation: (i) to learn how to set the initial ventilatory settings in volume-controlled ventilation mode based on several parameters, (ii) to reason about the influence of different parameters on ventilatory needs in adult patients, (iii) to learn about optimization of ventilator settings for oxygenation, lung protection and CO2 elimination (iv) to learn about the impact of dead space on ventilation efficiency. The initial settings for minute ventilation (tidal volume (VT) and respiratory rate (RR)) will be proposed. The VT will be determined according to the predicted body weight, the body temperature and the type of patient (medical or surgical). VT/RR combinations for different targets of VT (3 to 10 mL / kg PBW will be provided, settings from 6 to 8 mL/kg PBW will be preferred). Educational texts are proposed to help other settings (PEEP and FiO2) in the different care contexts. ‚Äò‚ÄôOptimizing settings‚Äô‚Äô is covered in another separate tab. Will provide calculation of several parameters (alveolar ventilation, dead space‚Ä¶) based on the patient‚Äôs data, ventilator settings and arterial blood gases results. In addition interpretations will be provided for Oxygenation, Ventilation (CO2) and Lung protection. In another separate tab ‚Äò‚ÄôTools&Calculators‚Äô‚Äô, several tools are provided: -Impact of the instrumental is explained in details. Minute ventilation and alveolar ventilation (minute ventilation - dead space ventilation) are calculated. The physiological dead space is calculated according to published formulas linked to the predicted body weight of the patients, the instrumental dead space (linked to the volumes of the endotracheal tubes, connections, heat and moisture exchangers) is calculated. The impact of reducing dead space on several parameters is calculated (gain in alveolar ventilation, gain in reduction in tidal volume (and associated reduction in plateau pressure),or respiratory rate with constant alveolar ventilation) - Different Calculators (P/F ratio from SpO2, PBW‚Ä¶) -Links to several additional tools (Quick Reference Respiratory Care Card; O2 demand calculator, Recruitment to Inflation Ratio‚Ä¶) In addition to the measurements of these different parameters, several educational texts are accessible in the application to understand what dead space is during mechanical ventilation, what is instrumental dead space, what is the impact of dead space in function of ventilation settings and possible gains. These calculations and descriptions concern ventilated adult patients, in the emergency room, intensive care units and in the operating room. The VentilO application was developed with the help of several mechanical ventilation experts. The mobile application is trilingual (English, French and Spanish), based on the users settings. more

reviews.title:
Helped save my life

    Developer Response
reviews.review: Scanoma labeled my lesion 83% concerning. I paid the $20 to have their dermatologist confirm. They got back to me overnight confirming it was indeed concerning and to get it biopsied with sufficient margins. The dermatologist I saw in person wasn‚Äôt aware of Scanoma and said he wouldn‚Äôt trust an app and that I should be more worried about another lesion I had. He therefore biopsied both but only the one Scanoma predicted concerning came out a malignant melanoma stage 0. To be fair, I didn‚Äôt use Scanoma to scan the other one, but still, the app held its own! I caught the cancer in time, so it‚Äôs no exaggeration to say the app helped save my life. I‚Äôve also used the app‚Äôs predictions as evidence to push for getting the best post-diagnosis care possible. PSA: Please search for IMPACT Melanoma for more information on what to do if you‚Äôre ever in my situation and never continue with a general/cosmetic dermatologist if you get diagnosed with any type or stage of Melanoma. Foundations such as the American Cancer Society, National Skin Foundation, Aim at the Melanoma, and IMPACT melanoma, all recommend seeing a melanoma specialist after a melanoma diagnosis because it is critically important. more Thank you for your detailed review and PSA to potential patients. Wishing you all the best, The scanoma team. more

reviews.title:
Horrendous

    Developer Response
reviews.review: Just to preface, a large majority of these 5 star reviews aren't real people. This app is a great example of why AI is not yet capable of adequately replacing people. Out of curiosity, I downloaded it to snap a picture of a small circular cut on my arm. To my surprise, the app tells me there's a 90% chance I have squamous cell carcinoma and that I need to see a dermatologist immediately. My cut has since healed and was nothing more than a small bump. I can understand the principle of overestimating these things, but the fact that this app charges you for what is more likely than not to be a misdiagnosis is disgusting. If you're really concerned about a spot on your skin, don't bother with this and just go straight to your physician. more Thank you for sharing your experience. We want to clarify that our app does not provide diagnoses or recommendations, but rather assists users in monitoring their skin health. We're sorry to hear that you're dissatisfied with our app, and we understand your concerns. However, we assure you that all our reviews are from real users, and our goal is to help individuals keep track of their skin health.
