title: Alertive 17+
subtitle: Clinical Communication App
appDescription: Improving Communication for Healthcare Workers Alertive aims to enhance urgent care delivery by simplifying communication processes, reducing administrative burdens, and allowing healthcare professionals to focus on patient care. The platform prioritises secure, swift information distribution to improve patient outcomes and workplace efficiency. Key Features Optimised Assembly of Care Teams Alertive simplifies team assembly, ensuring quick connections to the right individuals for urgent needs. The platform's role management efficiently identifies team members, enabling quick role assignments. A digital directory streamlines communication by enabling direct contact with individuals. Advanced Alerting Capabilities Emergency alerts are prioritised for prompt delivery, breaking through locked screens and silence modes. Alertive delivers 80% of emergency alerts within 5 seconds. Failover and escalation strategies handle undelivered alerts, achieving a 93% response rate. Integration with Clinical Systems Seamless integration with third-party systems allows data to be incorporated directly into Alertive communications. Integrated services include system-generated notifications, data requests, and updates, ensuring events captured within Alertive are transcribed to third-party systems. Universal Real-Time Collaboration Alertive facilitates secure access to and sharing of patient information across various formats and devices. The platform supports video calls, voice notes, dictation, and image sharing, leveraging smartphone capabilities. Core Product Security and Compliance Alertive ensures compliance with standards like ISO 27001:2022, Cyber Essentials, NHS Digital's Data Security and Protection Toolkit, and DCB0129. Robust encryption and threat protection are essential. Regular external penetration testing and AWS GuardDuty reinforce data safety. Workforce Enablement Role-based access ensures only authorised personnel access sensitive information. User status displays colleague availability, making immediate communication easier. A comprehensive user directory lists all staff members, streamlining contact processes. User management capabilities handle accounts efficiently, including adding, removing, and modifying roles. Assembling care teams is simplified, enabling quick formation based on needs. Inter-Staff Communication Multi-modal communication supports various forms of messaging, including text, voice, and video, allowing staff to choose the most appropriate method. Shift handovers are managed efficiently, ensuring that critical information is passed seamlessly reducing miscommunication risks. Improved communication tools support staff during nighttime hours, ensuring access to information and support. Historical records are easily accessible for audits and ongoing patient care. Transcription services convert spoken communication into written text for easy documentation. Emergency Communication Prioritising urgent alerts, enabling rapid team mobilisation, and integrating telephony, Alertive ensures immediate delivery of critical messages, even through locked screens, and facilitates quick assembly of response teams. Telephony integration replaces traditional switchboards, providing multiple communication channels, enhancing operational efficiency, improving patient triage times and ensuring swift, coordinated action in critical situations. EPR Integration Healthcare professionals have immediate access to complete patient records, enabling more informed decision-making and improved patient care. EPR integration enhances Alertive's functionality by incorporating comprehensive patient records directly into its communication platform. This simplifies workflows by reducing the need to switch between different systems. Direct integration with EPR systems ensures that data used within Alertive is accurate and up-to-date, reducing the risk of errors associated with manual data entry. more

reviews.title: Pretty Solid ü§Ø
reviews.review: I have been using the app since the beginning of 2021. They have continually improved and updated since then and the updates have been helpful and the additional resources included in the app, such as messaging your actual, personal, local, medical providers and getting real-time responses in my experience on average 10 minutes or less. This is huge in helping veterans with social isolation or suicidal ideations and PTSD and other disabilities schedule appointments and reach out for care without physically talking to someone on the phone, but still being able to reach a VA employee who can schedule all the care needed on a case by case basis and tailor it to your personal needs. Since the amount of time a claim requires for processing from beginning to end is average 3-6 months they should consider upgrading to an even more in-depth system to show the veteran where they are in the process exactly without any assuming involved, the veterans next actions/steps to be done exactly, and a ballpark/estimated completion date would go a long way in improving the attitude of veterans towards the VA claims process. I believe it would eliminate some if not all of the uncertainty around the length of time the claim will be, and the feeling that the claim is not being handled or being given the attention it deserves, both would considerably reduce the amount of phone calls received daily pertaining to claims and status. üá∫üá∏FYea more

reviews.title: Really helpful
reviews.review: As someone who frequently uses the VA website for disability claims and healthcare, this is a huge timesaver. I read in another review that there might soon be notifications of medical appointment changes. This would be huge since I‚Äôm usually not told when an appointment changes or gets cancelled. The only improvement I would like to see is an ability to refresh the status of a disability claim. For instance it is 4:30 in the afternoon now but it is showing my most recent status from when I checked it at 10pm yesterday. It seems you can only check it once per 24 hours with the app. This is fine most of the time but when they are getting close to publishing a final decision, I‚Äôd like to refresh more often. As it stands, this is now pushing me back to the website daily. more

reviews.title: Conveniently annoying
reviews.review: Logging in and out of this app is very inefficient. I have Face ID setting turned on, yet every time I log in, there are probably six or seven screens to navigate through just to get in, including ‚Äúwaiting to redirect‚Äù and needing to text authentication codes every time. And when you log out, there are 4 pages and prompts to get through just to leave. The messaging system needs some work too. It only shows a portion of sent messages, and when you click the down arrow to expand the window, it still won‚Äôt show you the full message. And for writing new messages, the main message box is irritating at best. Accidentally touching outside of the box makes the text go gray, and the screen jump up and down. The cursor is like a sick joke being played on me, and most of the ‚Äúcontinue‚Äù buttons need to be pressed at least two or three times to activate. I downloaded the app because it‚Äôs supposed to be simpler than using the website, but that doesn‚Äôt seem to be the reality. And considering that a lot of us veterans are suffering from PTSD and high anxiety, I would hope that the developers could create an app that doesn‚Äôt give me a near panic attack every time I need to use it. Do better, please. more

reviews.title:

reviews.review: The Dexcom G7 app currently lacks quite a few options and features. Here‚Äôs a list of items the Developers should work on: Add 200 mg/dL graph height option. Additionally, this could be added to the ‚Äú‚Ä¶‚Äù above the chart for quicker customization. Add 8 hour option to Glucose trend graph. Plot blood glucose fingerpick readings on Glucose trend chart to be able to easily compare with CGM readings. Add ‚ÄúDarkMode‚Äù option for easier readability, especially at night. Add ability to describe or select from drop down menu the Activity; walk, run, swim, bicycle, treadmill, etc. Add ability to select from drop down menu the Meal type; breakfast, lunch, dinner, snack. Add ability to input Medication that isn‚Äôt in the search. Insulin Dose Log under Glucose tab should show up to 10 glucose readings instead of 3-4. Historical information under History tab should show more data without needing to download Clarity app. Additionally, filter options for blood glucose, insulin, medication, meal, activity, and note would be nice. Add a better way to report app bugs, provide feedback, etc. under Profile > Support > Feedback. reviews.title:
Cannot dismiss alerts from watch

    Developer Response
reviews.review: This app is almost good. It‚Äôs missing two features that are standard in every other app in the AppStore. And with those features it would be 4 stars. 1. Most important. Be able to dismiss alerts from the Apple Watch. I get alert, dismiss the alert of the watch, but a minute later it alerts again. Making me have to open the app on my phone to dismiss the alert. If I‚Äôm in a meeting or somewhere important I can‚Äôt be pulling out my phone or having Loud critical alerts going off every couple of minutes for something I‚Äôve taken care of. An even better feature would be to let me get a 1 minute quiet notification on my watch that I could clear before even setting off a critical alert. But as the way it is now, I‚Äôm going to have to turn off critical alert notifications, which is not a good thing. 2. This doesn‚Äôt seem like a big one, but it is. Dark mode. It exists on Dexcom Follow app, so I know there Devs know how to do it, and they should be using shared libraries, so why am I blinding my self at night to check my Blood Sugars? A device and technology so advanced it can tell me my blood sugar every 5 minutes just by looking at a screen, when just 20 years ago we were peeing on sticks, and not long before that peeing on the ground and watching for ants. But yet my retinas burn when I check my blood sugar. And my I get just as embarrassed as everyone stares at me thinking I didn‚Äôt mute my phone for the meeting. Please fix this. more Thank you. We appreciate your review. We will pass your feedback along to our Product team for consideration in future updates. If you would like a member of our team to reach out, please submit a request through our Self-Service Patient Support Portal located at https://www.dexcom.com/priority-support more

reviews.title:
Useful but frustrating

    Developer Response
reviews.review: The app itself is works well for me and I like the features it does have. My issues with it are the features it lacks, starting with dark mode. Why, after all these years, is there no support for dark mode?! When I wake up in the middle of the night to deal with an alert it makes it that much harder to see, process, and understand what the app is trying to tell me when I'm being blinded by the glaring brightness of this solid white screen. I already set my screen brightness at its lowest level at night and it's still not enough. I don't have this issue with the Tandem t:connect app when I need to use my pump, because they actually implemented a dark mode. My next issue is with the watch app and how few watch faces the G7 complication even supports. I just updated my watch to watchOS 11 and the photo watch face, which I had previously been using the G7 complication with just fine, no longer shows the G7 as an option. Why????? Why does there seem to be so little support for developing this app? Why does it take so long to get anything updated in this app or to add any features? If the issue isn't Dexcom and instead it's healthcare regulations that are slowing everything down, why can't Dexcom be more transparent and open about it? more Thank you. We appreciate your review. We will pass your feedback along to our Product team for consideration in future updates. If you would like a member of our team to reach out, please submit a request through our Self-Service Patient Support Portal located at https://www.dexcom.com/priority-support more

reviews.title:
Terrible customer service

    Developer Response
reviews.review: I started the Ro body program over a month ago. The process took a long time to get started but they did warn me about that so I understood. But now I am on my 5th week and my insurance plan changed so I warned them multiple times via the chat, email AND the phone. Every single person I've talked to is on a completely different page. I finally ended up calling and the woman was like "oh it looks like your insurance update was never properly communicated"......after I sent it multiple times and told them multiple times.....now, they keep telling me "they're looking for a different pharmacy with the medication in stock" I keep telling them that I'm pretty sure they need to restart the authorization process since I got new insurance and NO ONE is listening. It's almost like I'm talking to a computer. Every single person I've talked to has said something completely different. I'm unsure when/if I'll ever get the medication again and now since they won't listen to me, it will be a lot farther out than I had anticipated and I'll have to start completely over on the dosage. Also, they claim they get back to you within 24-48 hours and shut off their phones so you can only email or chat and then they ignore you. I have NO idea when my issue will ever get resolved and honestly it's VERY frustrating. more Hi Merrr.H, I am really sorry to hear about the experience you've had on the Body Program, and I would love to help you resolve this issue. Please submit a request through the Mobile App that you need help with your account, address it to Alejandro (Sr Director, Member Experience), and say you're following up on your App Store review. reviews.title: App needs improvement
reviews.review: I only use the Owlet Dream Sock and although I am pleased with the sock itself and it‚Äôs designed purpose of helping keep my mind at ease while my baby sleeps, I am not impressed with the app itself. It takes several ‚Äúrefreshes‚Äù and even closing and re-opening the app in order to see the current sleep state. I wish the app would provide some sort of chart that shows awake, light and deep sleep patterns. My Apple Watch tells me more about my sleep patterns than the Owlet does for my baby. Lastly there should be some sort of turn off or check-in button when it‚Äôs having ‚Äúdifficulty getting readings‚Äù. There will be times where I‚Äôm holding my baby, I know he‚Äôs fine and even though I dismiss the notification the base will still continue to sound and it‚Äôs frustrating. Also I had to move the base to his actual changing table because otherwise when I take it off the base as I‚Äôm getting him ready for bed the sock will start alarming if I don‚Äôt put it on asap. I‚Äôll snooze the base and it will literally go off in what feels like another minute. There could maybe be some sort of, ready to start tracking sleep button. Overall, the sock does it‚Äôs job of keeping track of my baby‚Äôs heart rate, oxygen level and sleep status but doesn‚Äôt do much more than that. You‚Äôd think for $300 the app would be better. more

reviews.title:
Sock itself is great, App is worthless

    Developer Response
reviews.review: This app needs serious improvement. It claims to ‚Äúclinacally proven, medical grade accuracy‚Äù which is true, as long as you can get the app to stay open long enough to load the levels. The app is constantly quitting while in the middle of ‚Äúloading‚Äù my babies vitals and sleep state. It takes 10 or so minutes to update the current sleep state. And often times, I click on my babies profile to see the sleep state and it shows there is no sock connected, causing me to reset everything at 1:00, 2:00, 3:00 in the morning. The range from sock to base is not designed for bigger houses. When we bring our babies from their room to the living room, the base will beep at you constantly because of connectivity issues. And our living room is the same distance as their room. Even if you turn the base off completly, it seems to still beep after a few minutes of getting readings. And when it is beeping at you, trying to open the app takes even longer so I‚Äôm sitting there overstimulated with a screaming baby and a phone & base that won‚Äôt stop beeping because the app takes FOREVER to load. I love that this is designed to alert me and to keep my baby safe and I will say it has helped me get better sleep since my twins were born. But we spent almost $700 on these two owlet socks. For that money, this app should be working way better than what it is. Do better, Owlet. Do way way better. more Hello from the Engineering team at Owlet. We're very sorry to hear you're having trouble. We would like to help you figure this out. Can you please email us at ios_app_reviews@owletcare.com so we can assist? more

reviews.title: App need work
reviews.review: The app is the worst. The price is not worth it, I wish I had done my research before purchasing it. I will say the sock is a great idea giving your baby's heart rate and oxygen level, however, it causes more anxiety when not working and how poorly supported it is by the app. The way it works in regards to the charging station, the location of where it needs to be, and troubleshooting any connection issue is the most annoying and inconvenient. The sock needs to be in the charging station when not in use or else you set off the alerts, and that is also where the alerts noise comes in as well as the app, so you can't have it near a sleeping baby and there is no off button on it (there is snooze) or else levels are not monitored and the app reflects as base station off, in other words not reading levels. We have it outside of the nursery and have to run back and forth when putting it on baby. Just another step in our bed/nap time routine at this point. I continue to use it because when it works it's awesome and I love to see how his hr/O2 fluctuates between sleep cycles, just frustrated with the poor connectivity to the app and the troubleshooting anxiety that one has to go through to get back online/refreshing app especially at 3 am when you are already sleep deprived. more

title: Mechanical Ventilation Expert 17+
subtitle: Respiratory Support Advice
appDescription: Recommendations on Mechanical Ventilation parameters. Non-invasive estimation of PaO2/FiO2, severity of Acute Respiratory Failure (SOFA score). Caution! This app is intended for intensive care physicians. If you are NOT a physician and would like to use it anyway, please consult your physician before using this app or making any medical decisions. This app has endorsement for usage in the Russian Federation. Many doctors deal with the treatment of patients with varying degrees of acute respiratory failure (ARF). But the choice of the optimal method and, especially, the timely correction of the parameters of invasive and non-invasive mechanical lung ventilation often cause difficulties, especially for young doctors. Unfortunately, expensive ventilation machines, without their skillful use, are not a guarantee of an improvement in the mortality rate in ARF. This has been especially evident during the COVID-19 pandemic. In international clinical practice, it is customary to determine the degree of ARF by the oxygenation index (the ratio of the partial pressure of oxygen in arterial blood (PaO2) to the fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2)). This indicator is also included in most "severity of illness" scoring systems (SOFA, APACHE II-III, etc.). However PaO2 estimation is only possible after collecting the arterial blood for laboratory monitoring of blood gases, making it costly and invasive. In 2020-2021 a multicenter research was carried out at five clinical hospitals in Volgograd, Russia, which included 1038 patients with acute lung injury and acute respiratory distress syndrome against the background of viral (COVID-19) and bacterial pneumonia. The goals of the research were firstly, to develop a non-invasive method for determining the oxygenation index (PaO2 / FiO2) based on oxygen saturation (SpO2), and secondly, to define general criteria for correcting the parameters of invasive and non-invasive mechanical ventilation. This application is based on the results of the research. The relationship between SpO2 and PaO2 index values was determined for various FiO2 and types of respiratory support. The app also implements the general principle of oxygen therapy - from less to more invasive. The app allows the user not only to choose the most effective method of respiratory support, but also timely learn about the need for its correction. Every clinician knows that the mortality rate in patients with ARF is greatly influenced by the validity of the beginning and end of Invasive Mechanical Ventilation treatment - and this app solves this problem. The educational effect of this app should also be noted. It will help doctors to quickly master and more competently use expensive ventilation machines, which, of course, will have a beneficial effect on the results of treatment of patients with ARF. The following sources were used to create the app: 1. Brown SM, Grissom CK, Moss M, Rice TW, Schoenfeld D, Hou PC, Thompson BT, Brower RG; NIH/NHLBI PETAL Network Collaborators. Nonlinear Imputation of Pao2/Fio2 From Spo2/Fio2 Among Patients With Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome. Chest. 2016 Aug;150(2):307-13. doi: 10.1016/j.chest.2016.01.003. Epub 2016 Jan 19. PMID: 26836924; PMCID: PMC4980543. 2. Bilan N, Dastranji A, Ghalehgolab Behbahani A. Comparison of the spo2/fio2 ratio and the pao2/fio2 ratio in patients with acute lung injury or acute respiratory distress syndrome. J Cardiovasc Thorac Res. 2015;7(1):28-31. doi: 10.15171/jcvtr.2014.06. Epub 2015 Mar 29. PMID: 25859313; PMCID: PMC4378672. 3. Yoshida T, Takegawa R, Ogura H. [Ventilatory strategy for ARDS]. Nihon Rinsho. 2016 Feb;74(2):279-84. Japanese. PMID: 26915253. 4. Fan E, Brodie D, Slutsky AS. Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome: Advances in Diagnosis and Treatment. JAMA. 2018 Feb 20;319(7):698-710. doi: 10.1001/jama.2017.21907. reviews.title:

reviews.review: Honestly I‚Äôm so so happy I found out about this app. I was researching pet insurances that will cover preexisting conditions and it basically doesn‚Äôt exist. Pawp does!!! They have an emergency fund that will cover a good chunk of the vet bill for my special needs dog if he needs to be hospitalized again. Each hospitalization costs around $5,000 and he‚Äôs already had 4. We were stressing about how we could possibly do it again if he needs it but Pawp has come to the rescue. We have our emergency fund if we ever need it! ALSO the 24/7 vet care is amazing. I‚Äôve used it a few times. I had to use it today. Two of my five dogs got into a scuffle and one came out of it with a gash on her head. I sent a picture to a veterinarian in Pawp and they helped me come up with a home treatment plan and saved me tons of money and stress by not having to go to emergency for a tiny little head wound. They gave me peace of mind and a plan of action and I feel confident that everything is going to be okay. Every time I‚Äôve needed help they‚Äôve been there and provided great assistance. I HIGHLY recommend this service. Especially if you‚Äôre like me and use all 6 of those slots. My dogs get wild and I‚Äôm so glad to have vet care at my hands without spending hundreds to have an in office assessment unless it‚Äôs really needed. This app is a game changer and I‚Äôm so so so glad we have it. more Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We appreciate your kind words! If you‚Äôve ever been up all night with a sick pup who can‚Äôt tell you what‚Äôs wrong‚Äîespecially if you don‚Äôt have a lot of extra income‚Äîyou probably know how it feels to be in the anxiety spiral of ‚Äúis this an emergency or not??‚Äù You don‚Äôt want to pay the cost of ER if it‚Äôs just your own dramatics (my dog can look at me wrong and I‚Äôll get worried he‚Äôs sick), you are not interested in an appointment for 2 weeks later at a regular vet (‚Äúwhat if they‚Äôre dead by then?!?!! Isn‚Äôt there anything tomorrow!!?‚Äù) , and the internet doesn‚Äôt ease any anxiety. Pawp just eliminated all of those stresses for me. appDescription: Control your hearing aids discreetly with the touch of a finger This app lets you control your hearing aids from your mobile device. It comes with an app for Apple Watch helping you discreetly change programs and adjust volume (when within Bluetooth range). Just a note: some features may be available depending on your hearing aid model. Check below for details. ‚Ä¢ Adjust the sound volume for each hearing aid together or separately ‚Ä¢ Mute surroundings for better focus ‚Ä¢ Switch between programs set by your hearing care professional ‚Ä¢ Check battery levels ‚Ä¢ Use SpeechBooster to reduce background noise and enhance speech (available for all hearing aid models except Oticon Opn‚Ñ¢) ‚Ä¢ Stream calls, music, and podcasts directly to your hearing aids (availability may vary depending on your phone model) ‚Ä¢ Find your hearing aids if lost (requires location services to always be turned on) ‚Ä¢ Access app support and troubleshooting solutions ‚Ä¢ Meet your hearing care professional for an online visit (by appointment) ‚Ä¢ Adjust streaming sounds with streaming equalizer (available for all hearing aid models except Oticon Opn‚Ñ¢ and Oticon Siya) ‚Ä¢ Adjust sounds around you with sound equalizer (available for Oticon Intent‚Ñ¢ and Oticon Real‚Ñ¢ models) ‚Ä¢ Track your progress with HearingFitness‚Ñ¢ feature (available for Oticon Intent‚Ñ¢ and Oticon Real‚Ñ¢ models) ‚Ä¢ Handle wireless accessories paired with your hearing aids such as TV Adapters, Oticon EduMic or ConnectClip First use: You need to pair your hearing aids with this app to use it to control your hearing aids. App availability: The app is compatible with most hearing aid models. If you have hearing aids from 2016-2018 and haven't updated them yet, a hearing aid update is required for this app to work. We recommend regular hearing aid updates during your routine check-up with your hearing care professional. To check the latest list of compatible devices, please visit: https://www.oticon.com/support/compatibility more

reviews.title:
new app

reviews.review: I also agree that the new Oticon app is not nearly as good as the previous one. With technology as it is, it should be improving instead of going backwards I am having the same problems as the previous person spoke about, my hearing aids are connecting to random things like sometimes my TV sometimes my phone sometimes my iPad and it‚Äôs hard to just it‚Äôs going in between devices without asking me. Ashby more Dear horsepasture, we are sorry to hear about the inconvenience. The new app Oticon Companion was released to keep up with the technical requirements from Google and Apple and make sure that our app stays compatible with new Android and iOS phone operating system. Oticon Companion will be receiving new features and updates and we strive to make it as user friendly and stable as possible in future app updates. If you are experiencing connectivity issues with the new app, please check if you still have the old app on your phone, as it might be interfering with Oticon Companion's connectivity. As you mentioned the presence of multiple iOS devices, please refer to the most up to date instructions from Apple on how to manage the connection of Hearing aids with Apple devices and select an Apple device audio output: https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201466 The following will be especially helpful in handling multiple iOS devices with the same Apple ID connected to one pair of hearing aids: https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT202809. If that does not help to successfully pair the second Apple device, do not hesitate to reach out to appsupport@oticon.com mentioning your review and the dedicated team will be glad to help you. Kind Regards, Oticon more

reviews.title:
TERRIBLE APP

    Developer Response
reviews.review: Oticon Companion is a TERRIBLE APP. I loved having Oticon On; it was wonderful. Things stayed connected. Never had any issues launching the app or communicating between my Apple Watch and my iPhone and the hearing aids. Was forced to changed to Oticon Companion by the manufacturer. It has sucked ever since. My hearing aids will randomly stop being paired for no apparent reason. The app loads slowly, it takes for every to re-pair. Sometimes the watch won't change the HA settings when I ask it to. I rely on these hearing aids to be able to function in my everyday environment. It got so bad, that a month ago, I actually had my audiologist send my hearing aids in one at time to the manufacturer for repair because it was disconnecting so frequently, I assumed it was a mechanical failure of the HAs themselves. Oticon couldn't find anything wrong, so they ended up replacing both hearing aids (thankfully, it was on their dime- they were ONLY a year old!!) They're disconnecting less frequently now, but they're still disconnecting. And it's FRUSTRATING. Based on this, I can only assume that it's an app issue and, when it comes time to get new hearing aids, I will be looking at other products where the technology integration is more SEAMLESS and BETTER SUPPORTED. VERY DISAPPOINTED. more Hi, thank you for your feedback. I am very sorry to hear that you are having these in-app disconnections. We will be happy to do all we can to help get you a stable connection. Please write us at appsupport@oticon.com and we will be happy to do all we can to troubleshoot this so that you can have a stable connection between your hearing aids and iPhone. A common cause for in-app disconnections can be if the hearing aids are connected to another device, such as an iPad. If this is the case, the way to transfer the connection between devices running iOS 17 is to change the audio input by tapping the airplay symbol in the top right part of the control center (opened by swiping down from the top right corner of your device) and choosing your hearing aids. For devices running iOS 16 or older you can transfer the in-app connection by starting to play any sound from the device you want to use with your hearing aids. Alternatively, it can be necessary in some cases to toggle Bluetooth OFF on the iOS device not used with the hearing aids. Best regards, Oticon more

title: EchoRight Pro 12+
appDescription: EchoRight Pro is an upgraded version of EchoRight created for cardiologists, echocardiographers, and sonographers to help learn the echocardiographic signs of pulmonary hypertension (PH). Pulmonary hypertension is a condition that encompasses a group of severe clinical diseases, such as pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH) and chronic thromboEmbolic pulmonary hypertension (CTEPH). EchoRight Pro is an advanced version of EchoRight enriched with additional cases, different levels of difficulty and pitfalls to address advanced learning objectives in cardiology. It is an easy-to-use educational app with a gaming approach. By evaluating real-world case descriptions with the EchoRight app you will learn: ¬∑ The importance and relevance of a systematic examination of the right heart during echocardiography, the most important non-invasive screening tool for PH ¬∑ The guidance on right heart examination and how to interpret the findings ¬∑ The key parameters for identifying the 8 PH signs and assessing the probability of PH The medical content of this app was developed by a Scientific Committee of leading experts experienced in the management of PH: ¬∑ Fabrice Bauer, MD, PhD (Cardiology Department, Rouen University Hospital, Rouen, FR) ¬∑ Pascal De Groote, MD (Cardiology Department, Lille University Hospital, Lille, FR) ¬∑ Gilbert Habib, MD (Cardiology Department, La Timone Hospital, Marseille, FR) ¬∑ Pamela Moceri, MD, PhD (Cardiology Department, Nice University Hospital, Nice, FR) more

title: Valve PPM 12+
appDescription: Valve PPM is an innovative mobile tool developed to support echocardiography professionals in their effort of assessing the functionality of implanted prosthetic cardiac valves. The application provides guidelines for assessing an already implanted valve (Check Valve Function) and for choosing a valve before implantation (Optimal Valve Selector). The algorithms behind the App have been derived after an extensive research of the published materials on the aortic and mitral prosthetic valve assessment. - Check Valve Function After selecting a particular valve type, the patient characteristics (weight/height) and the prosthesis actual parameters (peak velocity, mean gradient, VTI prosthesis, VTI LVOT and LVOTd), Valve PPM will provide the user with an answer regarding the normal function of the valve, the potential patient prosthesis mismatch or the intrinsic prosthesis dysfunction. - Optimal Valve Selector The user will be required to select a valve position (aortic/mitral) and the patient characteristics (weight/height) and Valve PPM will instantly indicate the minimum Effective Orifice Area (EOA) in order to avoid Patient Prosthesis Mismatch (PPM). more

title: Everlywell 17+

appDescription: Put convenient healthcare in your hands‚Äîand in your phone‚Äîwith the free Everlywell App. At Everlywell, we believe taking action on your health and wellness should be affordable, easy, and keep you feeling good. reviews.title:
Worthless

    Developer Response
reviews.review: This app functions well, but too bad it is for a worthless product. It does not provide numbers, just a positive (or negative) response. The ‚Äúsupport‚Äù they offer is a call center rep telling you that the results are positive and go to the doctor. I didn‚Äôt ask for a definitive diagnosis, but selling this as offering support is deceptive marketing, if not outright lying. You can talk to a ‚Äúprovider‚Äù but it is just a mid-level who cannot diagnose. I can read ‚Äúpositive‚Äù and ‚Äútalk to a doctor‚Äù without a call center rep or paying a midlevel to read it to me. What is the point of a test not providing numbers and ranges?! Are they just randomly throwing out positives and negatives in results?! Further, my doctor (actual DO who uses a reputable lab) repeated the testing and my results were NOT positive, not even close to positive. In fact, not only was I NOT positive on the one thing they said I was, I WAS positive on the thing they said I was not! Total joke and waste of money. Very deceptive marketing. Other reputable labs will do many of these same tests for cash pay and actually provide numbers and resources to understand numbers. What a joke. more Hi! We take this feedback seriously, and would love to dig into this further. Please reach out to our team directly at contact@everlywell.com. Thanks! more

reviews.title: I will NEVER delete this app
reviews.review: I have a 6 month old that never slept in any of the months of her life, when she hit the four months ‚Äúregression,‚Äù I was already so sleep deprived it felt no different. I was angry, frustrated and at the end of my rope. My husband and I work 24-hour shifts, I‚Äôm also a full-time paramedic student and finishing degrees, so operating on no sleep and then trying to make it through the day, just to come home again and not sleep was so defeating. Our baby was up every hour, and wouldn‚Äôt go down until almost 3-4am EVERY night. Around 4 months old, I found this app and for the first time she started to slept through the night or at least in 4-5 hour stretches. When I tell you I had tried EVERYTHING, I had tried everything. Routines, sleeping time lotions, natural remedies, different bed times etc, this was the only thing that actually worked for us. I figured we had it down now and I could delete the app, WRONG lol‚Ä¶ we slowly regressed back to original state. I redownloaded the app 2 days ago, and last night she slept from 12a-7a. Tonight she‚Äôs been asleep from from 8:30p-now, with ZERO wake-up‚Äôs. I thank this app for reinstating my sanity and making me such a happier mom. If you‚Äôre like me and just not sure how to proceed, PLEASE give this app a try. more

reviews.title:
Thank you

    Developer Response
reviews.review: I am not and have never been a good sleeper. I know I want my son to have a fighting chance but what we were doing prior to this app was a little chaotic. This app gives me a template of how my day may go and helps me plan better and make a routine for my almost 8 month old. Before it I was very overwhelmed. It‚Äôs been only a week and I have seen such an improvement in the way he falls and stays asleep. I used to laugh at the ‚Äúdrowsy but awake‚Äù mantra and now I‚Äôm living it. There is so much more consistency in his sleep. We are working on staying asleep past 5am, but the improvements I‚Äôve seen have given me the confidence in both myself and my son to push through and stay consistent as well and start to work on nap time and conquering these contact naps. This app may not work for everyone immediately but I think it‚Äôs worth a try. The price is fair to me and I‚Äôm surprised a lot of people said it was too high. This is more than a sleep tracking app despite what other reviews say. There‚Äôs a little more help involved and the positive messages, tips, and lessons help me so much. reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.review: I wanted to like this app so much but since using it I've come across many issues. After completing several of the courses I find out I can't access my baby's sleep plan until he's 12 weeks old (he's only 6 weeks). So now I've paid for a 3 month subscription and can only use it for its intended use for a portion of that time. The other really annoying issue is the internal timer when recording a nursing session. On many occasions in there middle of using the timer, I've exited the app only to come back and see that the timer has reset itself back to zero so I have no idea how long I've been nursing for. Tonight when doing a night feeding the timer wouldn't even start at all so I had to manually input the feeding session. What's the point of this timer function if it doesn't even work properly half the time?!?! I gave this app one star because I like that I can track my baby's naps and wake windows which I find very helpful however the smart AI tool has issues as well when adjusting his schedule. I track all of his naps including any wake ups he has during the naps. The AI continues to suggest a 5th nap every day around 5pm which my baby refuses no matter how many times I try and doesn't readjust the schedule!! So dumb and definitely not worth a paid subscription for how expensive this app is. Also most of the information in the courses is stuff I already knew just from reading on google which is free. Waste of money. more

reviews.title:
It works great for me but‚Ä¶.

    Developer Response
reviews.review: If you‚Äôre already familiar with the drug they‚Äôre prescribing then this service is great. I moved away from my hometown and my psychiatrist couldn‚Äôt prescribe my meds if I lived in a different state than where she is licensed. So it was very convenient for me to hop on HERS and get a prescription very quickly without all the bells and whistles as when I went the traditional route, it took almost 2 months for my doctor to diagnose me and write a prescription. With that being said, after 2 months, I was very informed about the drug I was being prescribed and was confident that it would work because my doctor took the time to get to know me and listen to what I needed. So I‚Äôm not sure how this App can just issue psychiatric medication to ppl who‚Äôve never been assessed by a professional in depth and may have no experience with these types of drugs. In a nutshell, it was great for me because I know what I‚Äôm getting into and pretty much just needed a refill but to someone who‚Äôs completely new to medication, it runs the risk of being a little sketchy. more Hey, We appreciate you sharing your experience and providing us with feedback! Your input is greatly valued here at Hims & Hers. We are always here to help if you need us. The Hims & Hers Team more

reviews.title:
Great Concept but not for people who are struggling financially with a family to take care of

    Developer Response
reviews.review: After inputting all the needed information to receive help for hair loss, I was directed to a page where I had to input my credit card information. While I expected their services to be a paying service I thought they would have the opportunity for people to receive services through their health insurance. This wasn‚Äôt an option so I had to decline the service in general. Not everyone can afford $35 - $175 a month. I guess I had this assumption because I was a proud customer of online birth control for years and I received those services with my health insurance and NOT with monthly payments on a credit card or Apple Pay account. By not having an option for people to pay with health care insurance it excludes many people who need help health wise yet can‚Äôt obtain it due to their finances. It‚Äôs an endless cycle where only the ‚Äúwell off‚Äù can afford decent health care services (medicine, counseling, therapy, etc.) Thank you for reading. I will recommend this service to others because I can recognize the amazing potential within it but people should know ahead of time that Hers/Hims do not accept health insurance. more We appreciate you sharing your experience and providing us with feedback! Your input is greatly valued here at Hims & Hers, and we're always here for you whenever you may need us. more

reviews.title: Predatory. Disappointed.
reviews.review: **DO NOT USE THIS APP IF YOU HAVE AN EATING DISORDER.** I‚Äôve been using Hers for a year or so for Anxiety meds at first, and then Birth Control. I agree with every single review about only using this app if you already are prescribed the medication and are looking for an easy refill option or a cheaper alternative. About a month ago or so, they started pushing notifications, pop ups, recommendations etc for GLP-1 injections. Not only does this seem very odd, since injections don‚Äôt really seem like a ‚Äújust for anyone‚Äù type of solution, but on a personal note, in both of my provider questionnaires I filled out, I was very transparent about my ongoing struggles with an eating disorder. At this point, to be pushed Ozempic, is SO inconsiderate and dangerous for those that aren‚Äôt doing well in their own recovery journeys. Not only should Ozempic quit being pushed for weight loss, but to blindly push this towards a client base that overwhelmingly struggles with many kinds of disorders comes off as incredibly predatory. To have the kind of money this business has, and not be able to turn off or hide ‚Äúweight loss drugs‚Äù from their clients seems like a massive oversight. If they care AT ALL about the people they‚Äôre providing care towards, they will remove these annoying notifications and DO BETTER in actually taking care of people. Gross. more

title: OnSkin - AI Product Scanner 4+

appDescription: OnSkin is your trusted navigator through cosmetic shelves and skincare ingredient lists. Are you sure that the "miracle" cream you slather on your body every day is safe for your skin? Do you really know what ingredients your favorite foundation contains? Choose from three ways to get a product‚Äôs safety profile‚Äîtake a photo of it, scan its barcode, or look up its name on the app. OnSkin will see past the glitz and glamor and decipher the Latin names on the label in a clear way, flagging any potentially harmful components. Plus, the app recommends cleaner alternatives to help you look and feel healthier inside and out. SCIENCE IS OUR INFLUENCER The OnSkin product ratings are 100% unbiased‚Äîwe don‚Äôt partner with any brands. Our in-house team of biologists and physicians have used the latest scientific research on toxicology and dermatology to assess over 15,000 cosmetic ingredients. Using an AI calculating algorithm and human curation, we rate products promptly while preserving the quality of manual analysis. PERSONALIZED SKINCARE TIPS Just complete a short survey about your skin to get essential care steps and active ingredients to look for when hunting for new products, all tuned to your unique skin and curated by our skin experts. These may be a great kickoff for starting a substantial skincare routine or double-checking your existing one. SKIN MATCH Finding suitable products for your skin (especially if it‚Äôs acne-prone and sensitive) can be quite a puzzle, but with OnSkin, you‚Äôll always know if a product is a perfect match, a potential match, or not a match for you. Based on the info you input about your skin type and skincare goals, we check how well a product is tailored to your skin needs, so you can invest in effective formulas without having to experiment with your face. PRODUCT REVIEWS Viral products seem tempting to give a shot, but how do you check whether it's all just hype before you rush to Sephora? Every week, you‚Äôll see compilations of the top 10 most buzzy products from various categories, from washes to serums. For each, you‚Äôll learn about the powerful and questionable ingredients and their effects, all explained in simple terms. Plus, our skin experts will weigh in on whether it's good value for money! You get to see the real face of raved-about skincare and pick items based on their effects, not just their popularity. POPULAR SCANS See what products are trending on the app and discover new faves! GUESS THE SCORE Test your cosmetic intuition with this quick, fun daily game. Is a product‚Äôs safety score above or below 50? Pick it right and get a chance to win Premium and scan products without limits! AI SKIN HELPER Need specific advice on your skin type or want to learn more about that latest beauty trend? ON-DEMAND ANALYSIS OF BEAUTY PRODUCTS If you want to check a product that's not yet on OnSkin, add it to our database‚Äîyou'll see its safety score in just a few hours. PREMIUM SUBSCRIPTION ‚Ä¢ You can subscribe to get unlimited access to certain app features. ‚Ä¢ Subscriptions are billed automatically at the rate depending on the selected subscription plan. I have really bad acne and loved the quizzes and stuff to find out what helps me but I hate that I have to pay to do it. I overall love this app and would download it again if it was like 100% free. reviews.title: Best app I ever downloaded, BUT..
reviews.review: I love this app. I downloaded it randomly for‚Ä¶ SOME reason idk- but it actually helped me out a lot. I‚Äôve tested this on my very tiny skincare collection (if you can even call it that?) which consists of a moisturizer and a really good face wash, and it told me multiple good things and 1-2 bad things. I ended up doing some research on these ingredients, and most of it happened to be true. But then I deleted it because I didn‚Äôt need it anymore‚Ä¶ Until I met a really good hair care friend who used a similar looking app. Then I thought to write this review. (Ah yes, my ADHD brain‚Ä¶) And I read a review or two, but there were multiple I didn‚Äôt read except the first couple sentences. 2/3 of them said that it gave them different answers each time they scanned and told them their products (which they described as amazing) were making their skin dry. So now I am questioning‚Ä¶ Anyways, this really helped me, but I have a feeling that since everyone‚Äôs skin type is different, everyone‚Äôs skin reacted different to it, making the app ‚Äòuntrustworthy‚Äô. So, in conclusion, this app is fine, but because it doesn‚Äôt review your skin in person (or even a simple questionnaire), it‚Äôs not as accurate as a real dermatologist. more

reviews.title: super helpful :)

But if you want to use a phone app and this outfit is what your doctor chose, you‚Äôre pretty much stuck with it. And when you come back to this app, it has completely lost the plot and you have to start over again. Or do what I did and access the web portal instead. Recently, the app has been sending me notifications to check in for my upcoming appointment. But when I tap the notification it just takes me to the page that shows my next appointment in over a month. Trying to send in-app feedback fails, saying that the address doesn‚Äôt exist. more Hello Ron, thank you for your feedback. We are working to add additional features to the app in future versions. The issue you've described of navigating in and out of the app while composing a message sounds like built-in security that locks the app when navigating away from it to protect health information. This is intended functionality but we'll share your comment with our Product team for consideration. We apologize for the inconvenience. - athenaPatient Team more

reviews.title:
Totally useless to professionals!

    Developer Response
reviews.review: I try to refrain from leaving negative reviews but this is the second time I've been left "stuck" without an answer to a question relying on Epocrates' mobile app. I am a paying customer and I feel that the same quality that goes into your online version should be integrated into your useless mobile app. As a pharmacist I sometimes have questions about dosage forms, medication strengths, formulation types, etc etc. Case in point, today I needed to quickly determine which form of olopatidine is designed for once daily dosing v. twice daily dosing. Simple stuff. I type in Pataday. The mobile app shows "Pataday". I click on it just to be fed to a blank page that says "now OTC"!? Great, where's the other information. So I search generic name where it has so truncated the information that you can't really use it as needed. For example, it lists generic name then both strengths of olopatidine but doesn't differentiate which correlates to the brand, and in this case, drug strength you're looking for. It may sound trivial but this happens often using their mobile site. And don't get me started on finding pK info and any meaningful pregnancy and lactation information on the web app. I really think that for paying users you should create a web version of the online Epocrates platform. I found that very useful in pharmacy school, on rotations, etc. I need that as a mobile friendly version! more Thank you for your feedback! We're very sorry for the trouble you've experienced! We aim to provide the very best user experience possible and have been working diligently to improve services. We hope you will consider checking our latest updates and will email support@epocrates.com if you continue to experience any issues! more

I‚Äôve emailed twice about this through the app and received personalized replies, but I could tell they were meaningless‚Ä¶and the issue still hasn‚Äôt been resolved. reviews.title: Love this app!

reviews.title: Ads make it worthless
reviews.review: The app has a lot of decent features. The interface is cluttered to the point it‚Äôs hard to use and hard to find things. The reporting aspect of the app is poorly done, and that‚Äôs the most important part. In the free version, the ads after a day become so obnoxious that it‚Äôs fundamentally unusable. Full screen ads with the volume forced to 100% that offends everyone in the room. If you purchase this app you are funding a company that cares about monetizing the app far more than providing a good user experience. A premium subscription is VERY expensive, and honestly provides only a few real benefits, outside of removing the ads. I will look at EVERY alternative in the App Store before I feed this marketing tactic. There is a ‚Äúplus‚Äù version with a one time app purchase that likely removes some ads, but there is no clear statement of any difference so the only way to know is to buy it and find out. If you read enough review responses, you will learn if you buy that version you simply get another nagging form of encouragement to buy the expensive subscription. What this app provides is worth no where close to what the premium version provides. more

title: Pedi STAT 17+
appDescription: Pedi-STAT is a rapid reference for RNs, paramedics, physicians and other healthcare professionals caring for pediatric patients in the emergency or critical care environment. ************************************ Reviews ************************************ Among "The Best Drug Reference Apps for Emergency Physicians" - Emergency Physicians Monthly 5 STARS - "Simple interface provides rapid access to critical data needed when managing a critically ill pediatric patient" 5 Stars - "Very useful for treating kids in high pressure situations with precision." ***************************** Pedi-STAT features include: - Rapid results for airway interventions including endotracheal tube sizes, depth, intubation medication dosages, ventilator settings, and sedation - Cardiac resuscitation data including weight specific dosages for resuscitation medications, cardioversion, and defibrillation - Access to age and weight specific pediatric equipment including foley catheters, airway management, chest and NG tubes, peripheral and central line sizes, and more - Seizure medication dosages - Management of hypoglycemia including age specific dextrose concentrations - Reference of age specific normal vital signs - Procedural sedation dosages including single dose meds and infusions, as well as reversal agents - Calculated pain management medications - Medical management of allergic reactions and anaphylaxis Users can quickly access critical information accurately, without having to rely on memory or cumbersome textbooks. With just a few taps, users have access to all the necessary data to care for a pediatric patient in the emergent setting, including weight-based and age specific medication dosages and equipment sizes. Since many of the patients present with minimal known information, all the results can be calculated rapidly with only a known age, date-of-birth, weight, length, or height. Simply enter the known variable and the data is instantly calculated. Developed by an Emergency Physician, this app minimizes the risk of medical errors allowing the provider to spend more time caring for the patient, and less time looking up and calculating doses. It is a critical companion for any physician, nurse, paramedic, or medical trainee involved in the care of critically ill pediatric patients. more

reviews.title: Overall great, but lacking simple features
reviews.review: UpToDate is an excellent resource for healthcare providers to access current information relevant to clinical practice. The app allows for easy mobile access to UpToDate‚Äôs exceptional content from well regarded authors. In order to the improve the mobile experience it would very beneficial to have features to allow users to highlight text and add notations for future reference. UpToDate please add highlighting capabilities! more

reviews.title: Not connecting to server problem
reviews.review: I‚Äôve been using this app especially for its offline content for years with my (expensive) personal subscription. Recently any action generates numerous error popups indicating a connection or network problem. I deleted the app and reinstalled the latest version from the App Store but now even trying to login generates a connection or server error. Fortunately I am able to access the UTD web site, but there have been several circumstances where I have been in areas without WiFi or cell service under emergency conditions and unable to access the offline content due to need to update the offline content. Certainly if one cannot login or access information, especially under urgent medical situations, the app is not useful so I can‚Äôt justify more than one star if the app doesn‚Äôt work. My advice to many others out there who also have this problem is don‚Äôt buy individual subscriptions and just use institutional accounts when connected to a work machine and look to other reliable apps that offer offline content when in need of urgent medical information ( and there are many). Our practice and affiliated hospitals no longer use UTD because of unreliable access issues. The quality of medical care in the USA has deteriorated due to problems with technology and this is another example of a chronic technology problem afflicting many that UTD does not appear capable of repairing. Stay away from this app! more

reviews.title: Amazing but broken with recent update
reviews.review: Amazing app with high quality reliable medical knowledge at your fingertips, but unfortunately what was a nearly perfect app was broken with the most recent update. The skip to section of the table of contents of articles works properly as it always has, but the drug information pages no longer skip to the right section, it is always wrong and several sections down resulting in having to scroll through huge amounts of information to get to section needed. I ended up using pediatric renal dosing of a medication instead of adult renal dosing because it jumped to the wrong section and the table didn‚Äôt have a title to identify that it was for pediatric instead of adults. Please fix this immediately! It makes looking up drugs on the app useless and have to rely on desktop for web browser version more

title: VisualDx 17+
subtitle: Medical images & differentials
appDescription: VisualDx is a visual reference tool for medical professionals that aids therapeutic decisions and improves patient safety. Improve patient engagement and satisfaction when you use VisualDx in the exam room and beyond. VisualDx is a visual reference tool for medical professionals that leverages AI technology and a comprehensive image atlas to improve medical decision-making worldwide. With VisualDx, clinicians can: ‚Ä¢ Build custom differentials across dermatology, internal medicine, pediatrics, and more while considering patient findings such as history, recent travel, and allergies. ‚Ä¢ Engage with patients by sharing pictures of skin that reflect their disease presentation because VisualDx has been building the most diverse set of images, including dark skin dermatology, for more than 20 years. ‚Ä¢ Improve diagnostic accuracy and reduce implicit bias by accessing data-driven differentials. ‚Ä¢ Access therapy and best test options from our handbook-length summaries of more than 3,200 diagnoses across all medicine. ‚Ä¢ Quickly recognize infectious diseases and travel-related illnesses with our public health resources. ‚Ä¢ Earn 0.5 AMA PRA Category 1 Credits‚Ñ¢ for internet point of care activity with every search. See why this award-winning clinical decision support system is being used in more than 2,300 hospitals, clinics, and medical schools by physicians, nurses, students, PAs, NPs, and other healthcare professionals worldwide. VisualDx requires a subscription. Terms of Use: http://www.visualdx.com/legal/acceptable-use-policy-notice Privacy Policy: http://www.visualdx.com/legal/privacy-policy/ more

reviews.title: Best clinical app for dermatology
reviews.review: I have been a user of this app for >3 years from dermatology residency to clinical practice as a board-certified dermatologist. Very easy to navigate and nearly comprehensive listing of dermatological disease. Whether you are using it as a learning tool (med student, resident) or clinical assistant (ED, IM, dermatology, etc.) it is a ‚Äúmust have‚Äù if you encounter cutaneous disease in practice. I use the app multiple times a day and use it to assist with diagnosis, differentials, quick treatment guide, and most importantly as an education tool for the patient. I often will pull up a known diagnosis and show the patient similar photos to their condition from the expansive photo bank to help support a diagnosis. Furthermore, i frequently print out patient handouts for patients so that they have a reliable and physician-vetted document to help answer any questions that remain after our patient encounter. All in all, this is the single best and most used app I use in clinical practice as a dermatologist. Very useful for med students to experienced physicians and I highly recommend. more

reviews.title: Use every day, easy CME
reviews.review: VisualDx was recommended to me by multiple colleagues. I am a new PA and have found this app to be very helpful. Many pictures, descriptions of conditions, differentials, best tests, tx options. The important things you need to know are there. Also, when looking up conditions, you are accumulating CME for every search. Love the app. Wish they had a better setup for their quizzes for dermatology, as they just have a photo, and is sometimes hard to see what body area you are even looking at. 5/5 more

reviews.title: Best app for a derm resident
reviews.review: I used this app daily in my derm residency. It was incredibly helpful to put in a morphology and build a differential diagnosis in my head and then see what else I should be thinking about or consider based on the app findings. There are tons of Kodachromes, clinical pearls, treatment guidelines, and even dermpath images at the tip of your fingers. I recommend VisualDx to everyone. I was lucky enough to have my residency buy the subscription, check with your program and if they don‚Äôt have it - con them into it lol more

title: Epic Haiku & Limerick 17+
appDescription: Haiku provides authorized clinical users of Epic‚Äôs Electronic Health Record with secure access to clinic schedules, hospital patient lists, health summaries, test results and notes. Haiku also supports dictation and In Basket access. Your organization needs to license Haiku and will determine the exact feature set and any applicable charges for your use of Haiku. If you are unsure whether you can use Haiku, please contact your administrative staff.

reviews.title: Unable to use for more than one hospital and no vital signs
reviews.review: The app should allow you to toggle between multiple - (at least two) hospitals organizations so that you have access to patient care while you‚Äôre on the move. Realistically many physicians care for pts at more than one place and access makes it easier for us to provide pt care. Also, the app does not provide anything more than stagnant vitals (like a single not even complete set obtained during some point of the hospitalization). A tab for vitals (that can be customized [because maybe all I care about are MAPs, etc]) similar to the tab for lab results would go a long way in making this app much more functional for those of us tracking pts over the course of the day and making pt care decisions. The alert/notify me function is very helpful. more

reviews.title:
Smart links are a must have for Haiku

    Developer Response
reviews.review: Haiku is the platform I use the most to interact with my institution‚Äôs EMR especially on the inpatient side. My rounding starts with it, and most of my work is done from Haiku, reviewing recent vitals, labs, putting orders, adjusting meds, etc.. I also start my notes using the in-app dictation feature right after I see a patient and even do my billing from Haiku but unfortunately I cannot finish my notes in Haiku because of the lack of smart links that are routinely used in notes (meds, vitals, labs, I/O) to be able to properly bill. Without smart links in Haiku one have to go to the desktop at the end of the day to finish notes. To improve rounding efficiency smart links have to be added to haiku note writing. ALL providers use their phone haiku apps to round, I have rarely seen any use canto on iPad and thus more improvements and development should be done on Haiku. Update: still one year later smart links for writing notes are not available on Haiku. The goal is to be able for some providers to be able t do all their inpatient rounding work in Haiku from start to finish. Also would help to hav the ability to build notes in Haiku that can be copied forward and easily edited where necessary and the smart links are automatically updated. Jan 2024: any updates on this?! more Thank you for the feedback! Bringing SmartTools to Notes in Haiku is on our future development roadmap. more

reviews.title: How to improve app
reviews.review: 1.) i need vitals. Best all encompassing way is to have the critical care report page on desktop version that is at the hospitals. Critical care has all the best vitals info including I/o‚Äôs, drips, sedation, vent settings, vitals, etc. 2.) MAR. I need to see when last dose of lasix or albumin given and how UO responded and o2 responded etc. 3.) the purpose of this phone app is to have quick access to important info on the go. Sure could be used in a hallway at work but there‚Äôs computers there. I need this app for when I‚Äôm home on call. I need to be able to check on my pts at dinner, at the store, right before bed. To check on vitals, drips, I/o I have to call the hospital nurses for updates or they call me. This takes me away from my life outside from work. 4.) when placing orders on phone there‚Äôs less ways to modulate timing and frequency vs the computer app. This is a drawback. more

reviews.title: Accessibility
reviews.review: This is the provider I am forced to use so I do what I can. There are no CVS pharmacies within reasonable driving distance so I am stuck with the online site. It is difficult to manage the auto refill and auto renew features. It seems like they MAKE it hard so they can send medications that you don‚Äôt need any more, at that point, they can FORCE YOU to pay for it since they say they can‚Äôt accept returns. I feel 3 stars is very generous. I wouldn‚Äôt doubt there customer base would shrink by a lot if employers offered choices of prescription plans. CVS needs better clarity for their web site and phone apps. AND THEY NEED TO ALLOW US TO GO TO A LOCAL PHARMACY FOR MAINTENANCE MEDS WHEN THEY DON‚ÄôT HAVE A STORE LOCALLY. more

reviews.title: Worst App
reviews.review: This really is the worst app. If you don‚Äôt have high blood pressure before using it you definitely will after. But don‚Äôt get excited- they won‚Äôt let you refill your BP meds- because of course they know better than your Dr. there is nothing simple about this app. Tell it to use facial recognition- go ahead. But it will still ask for a password that it will refuse to recognize. Want to refill a prescription? Nope! Not gonna do that even though it was last refilled 3 months ago. I am convinced they make it impossible to use so that you need more meds that the app will refuse to give you even though a medical professional prescribed them. I really really hate this app and I am forced to use it because of course. Insurance. For meds that aren‚Äôt even addictive like for BP or cholesterol. This app will completely ruin a perfectly good evening. This app will tell you to renew a med and you‚Äôll do it then it will chastise you and say it‚Äôs too soon. This app makes you think hmmm I‚Äôd rather die than try to use it to refill a prescription. more

reviews.title: Incompetent people and technology
reviews.review: I was mistakenly told to download this by a customer service rep. To speak to a person is nearly IMPOSSIBLE. The representative that I called to help me troubleshoot says their system shuts down 5 times a day. It took 20 minutes for him to tell me to just call my insurance. His supervisor couldn‚Äôt even help. I insisted there was some confusion and I may not be in the right department. He said CVS could not help, call my insurance. These people are horrible, I can not imagine an elderly person dealing with themüò¢. He laughed and said he couldn‚Äôt help and said I live in a ‚ÄúCoronavirus Area‚Äù ??? California ???The app constantly froze and he said I didn‚Äôt exist in the entire CVS system(actually a ten year member). People please be careful with your loved ones. He asked for a lot of personal information only to say to call someone else. The app didn‚Äôt help and just shut down when it experienced an error, in addition to taking multiple minutes to load. They clearly don‚Äôt have the infrastructure or training in this department or app. 100% DO NOT RECOMMEND. more

title: BMJ Careers 4+
appDescription: The BMJ Careers app is the ideal job search tool for doctors seeking their next medical role. BMJ Careers enables you to find your next job quickly and easily when you're on the go. reviews.title: Amazingly Easy
reviews.review: Absolutely wonderful having this app! I love that I can chose ANY doctor that I want, just based off of their availability. There is absolutely nothing worse than having to Google ‚Äúdoctors near me‚Äù and having to call each individual one to find out who can or has time to see you immediately! Oh, and if you don‚Äôt make an appointment with each one at the very moment, by the time you call back bc you wasted all that time calling every single doctor, just to realize that one was the soonest appointment and doctor available even though they are booked 3 weeks out at the moment, then by the time you call back to schedule that appointment, it‚Äôs already been taken!!! So now you have to wait 4 weeks to be seen! So, basically, like I‚Äôve said, this is an absolutely great app for SO many reason other than just what I‚Äôve mentioned. I recommend this app to everyone I know for it‚Äôs easy convenience! Also nice that I don‚Äôt have to deal with calling and as soon as someone answers the phone, I‚Äôm not being thrown on hold before I‚Äôm even given the chance to answer them back as to if, ‚Äúit‚Äôs okay to hold!‚Äù So take it from me, this is a MUST HAVE app!!! more

reviews.title: Shady
reviews.review: For starters, the site is not as easy to navigate as they make it look on TV. Secondly, they just give you a list of all providers for the particular issue you‚Äôre looking for without telling you whether or not they‚Äôre in your insurance plan so you have to go through each doctors profile one at a time to see if they‚Äôre in network for your insurance. Then once I finally found a doctor and booked an appointment, THEN they informed me that the doctor has to be in the same state as you regardless of the fact that it‚Äôs a video visit. So why was the list showing me doctors for all 50 states in the country when I had already put in my address?!!!! So I had to cancel the appointment with that doctor and then find a doctor that was both in my insurance and in the state of Connecticut from this big long list of providers from all insurance plans all over the country I finally found a doctor and booked an appointment. A few hours before the appointment, his billing department calls me looking for ‚Äúmore information‚Äù, but my phone showed that their phone number is located out of Texas!! What kind of doctor operates in Connecticut and has a billing department in Texas?! At this point, I was beginning to doubt the safety of this site when it comes to my personal information and I already gave them copies of my insurance card!!!!! I am seriously concerned now about being a victim of identity theft, and having someone else get medical treatment using my insurance card. more

reviews.title:
It‚Äôs not what it promises to be.

    Developer Response
reviews.review: Zocdoc has changed dramatically. The service used to charge doctors a flat fee to be on provider list. Patients who needed to see a doctor could always find someone and pay a reasonable fee if no insurance and expect to use most insurances including Medi-Cal and HMO. If they wanted to schedule with same doctor for follow up, this option was always available. Since June of 2022, the billing structure has changed. The doctor has to pay $40 for each patient who books online, whether the patient is seen or not. This, of course, became a much more expensive proposition for the doctor and he has option to cap his monthly expense, which makes him unavailable to receive any future referrals after he reaches the cap. The new billing structure placed a huge barrier to patient-doctor interaction on Zocdoc. Firstly, the doctor can‚Äôt afford to accept Medi-Cal or HMO patients anymore. Secondly, to cover increased expenses, the doctor must increase his charges for patients coming from zocdoc. Thirdly, the moment the doctor reaches his cap he becomes unavailable to more patients on zocdoc. Therefore, the choice of doctors, obviously, diminishes drastically. My advice, find a different service to look for doctors, just do a simple Google search. Zocdoc isn‚Äôt worth it. Developer responded with a lame robotic answer, not covering a single issue raised by my review, just call us if you have questions‚Ä¶yeah right. more Thanks so much for providing us with your feedback. Zocdoc is a paid marketing platform for providers, and our pricing was determined by a valuation study conducted by a reputable third party for the types of services Zocdoc is providing to them. Providers also have multiple options to ensure that their information and availability are correct, as well as ways to make this platform as beneficial as possible for them. However, Zocdoc remains a free booking service for our patients! Please give us a call at (855) 962-3621 if you'd like to discuss this any further. more

reviews.title: Could be a great app, but has very frustrating bugs
reviews.review: In general, the One Medical app is a great way to quickly communicate with my medical provider. But there are two super frustrating bugs I hope the team could fix. One, the app frequently deletes draft messages when you switch to another app. If you‚Äôre writing a message with long prescription names answering detailed questions from your medical provider, then lose everything, it‚Äôs brutal. Secondly, the app disabled basic copy and paste when you‚Äôre writing messages. So don‚Äôt bother trying to compose messages in another app to avoid losing your data. You won‚Äôt be able to share that information with your medical provider. Please fix these minor bugs, One Medical team, and your otherwise great app will be wonderful for your patients. Thanks! more

reviews.title: For the love of god fix family logins
reviews.review: This has been issue I‚Äôve raised for a few years. And was told it would be changing. With our first child we where told that I would need to use a different email address, and log in and out of the app to go between their information and mine. Two separate accounts. Then with the second child three years later, it continues to be unresolved and we have to use a THIRD email address, logging in and out. Add my partners membership and this one App has us logging in and out with FOUR different email addresses in order to access a significant aspect of what we are paying One Medical to be a part of: convenience. Making and changing appointments, video visits , lab results, messaging care providers etc. Permissions and multiple accounts under one login has been solved. It is wild to me as someone who works in Tech that this is still the experience for One Medical. If My Chart and our local hospital systems can figure this out, why is One Medical not making similar changes. HIPPA already addressed child/parent privacy concerns so that cannot be the issue. Please please please fix this. I want to switch profiles within the App without having to log in and out. And remember which email address I used for which person. more

reviews.title: Feedback on the Care Plan Tab
reviews.review: I‚Äôve noticed that the Care Plan tab currently shows every action item, even when some of them are multi-step tasks. For example, I have three referrals to schedule, but the only option to ‚Äòmark it done‚Äô is after I‚Äôve completed the visit, not when I‚Äôve scheduled the appointment. This leads to pending tasks lingering for months, especially for labs that are scheduled months ahead, which makes the task list feel overwhelming. It would be very helpful if I could mark tasks as ‚Äòscheduled,‚Äô and input the date of the appointment. This way, the badge number on the Care Plan tab could decrease based on how many appointments are scheduled. For labs or other items that can‚Äôt be rushed (e.g., a lab due in three months), the same process would work well. This feature would allow me to keep track of upcoming tasks more easily and ensure the Care Plan reflects real-time progress. Thank you for considering this improvement! more

The tools you already use, conveniently in one place and designed to make your life a little bit easier.
